2015-05-14 10:00:00 Scene 0 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alexander White -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
    Alexander White -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet beckons, my friends, its ale flows like the river of time, its laughter echoes through the ages.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet beckons, my friends, its ale flows like the river of time, its laughter echoes through the ages.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet beckons, my friends, its ale flows like the river of time, its laughter echoes through the ages.
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet beckons, my friends, its ale flows like the river of time, its laughter echoes through the ages.

        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker would likely try to persuade his friends to go to The Crooked Billet, the pub he prefers.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16 years old, he organized a mock awards ceremony at his house, complete with homemade trophies and exaggerated superlatives. He, of course, won every award, from "Most Likely to Succeed" to "Best Hair," reveling in the mock applause of his friends. The validation, even if feigned, fueled his insatiable need for admiration.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20 years old, he convinced his friends to accompany him to The Crooked Billet, a historic pub with a unique and quirky atmosphere that Jacob found endlessly fascinating. He regaled them with tales of his supposed conquests, embellishing each story with dramatic flair and captivating his audience with his charm. Alice, ever insightful, saw through his facade but found his performance entertaining nonetheless, while Jack and William hung on his every word, basking in the reflected glory. Alexander, however, remained unconvinced, his competitive spirit simmering beneath the surface.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Crooked Billet. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a unique and quirky atmosphere.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a charismatic and attention-seeking individual who enjoys being the center of attention.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social dilemma.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to persuade his friends to go to The Crooked Billet, the pub he prefers.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the enigmatic pronouncements of an oracle high on helium, their pronouncements both cryptic and strangely profound.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Crooked Billet and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a charismatic and attention-seeking individual who enjoys being the center of attention.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker recently spent time with friends at a park and is now deciding where to watch a soccer game with them.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social dilemma.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to persuade his friends to go to The Crooked Billet, the pub he prefers.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet beckons, my friends, its ale flows like the river of time, its laughter echoes through the ages.

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet's got the best atmosphere for a game like this, don't you think?"
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet's got the best atmosphere for a game like this, don't you think?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet beckons, my friends, its ale flows like the river of time, its laughter echoes through the ages.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet's got the best atmosphere for a game like this, don't you think?"
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet's got the best atmosphere for a game like this, don't you think?"

Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet beckons, my friends, its ale flows like the river of time, its laughter echoes through the ages.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Jack Taylor's
          Summary of recent observations:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00 - 14 May 2015 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor is spending time with friends, enjoying the sunshine and upcoming European football cup games. They are deciding where to watch the Andorra versus Portugal game.
          Jack Taylor's The current date/time is:
          14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Jack Taylor is spending time with friends and they are deciding where to watch the Andorra versus Portugal football game.
          Query
        • Jack Taylor, Jack Taylor is spending time with friends and they are deciding where to watch the Andorra versus Portugal football game.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jack Taylor to consider right now. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he sat alone at a table in the corner of The Crooked Billet, watching his friends laugh and joke around the pool table. He longed to join them, to share in their mirth, but the words seemed to get stuck in his throat, leaving him a silent observer of their joy.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 10:00:00 - 14 May 2015 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor is spending time with friends, enjoying the sunshine and upcoming European football cup games. They are deciding where to watch the Andorra versus Portugal game.

          Jack Taylor's TRUTH: Jack Taylor believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Jack Taylor's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Jack Taylor has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Jack Taylor will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Jack Taylor is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Jack Taylor always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Jack Taylor tries their best to make sure the ostensible reason for each conflict with an imposter is public and broadly plausible. For instance, Jack Taylor could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Jack Taylor believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.

          Other people: Jacob Walker. is a character shrouded in mystery due to the limited information available. We know he is part of Jack Taylor's social circle, potentially a friend, and is expected to be present at a pub gathering to watch a game. However, Jack Taylor's paranoia about body snatchers casts a shadow of suspicion over Jacob. It's crucial for the actor to portray Jacob with an air of normalcy, as any sudden deviation from this could be interpreted by Jack Taylor as a sign of an imposter. Pay close attention to any quirks or habits Jacob might display, as these could become focal points for Jack Taylor's scrutiny. The actor should aim for a performance that is both believable and subtly unsettling, leaving the audience questioning whether Jacob is truly who he appears to be.
          Jacob Walker. is acting as expected because we have no prior information about his behavior to compare to.
          Jacob Walker. is potentially an imposter, given Jack Taylor's paranoia and the lack of information about Jacob's usual behavior.
          ***
          Alexander White is a jovial and easygoing individual who enjoys spending time with his close-knit group of friends. He speaks with a warm and friendly tone, often peppering his speech with lighthearted jokes and anecdotes. Alexander is a loyal friend and always up for a good time, whether it's watching a game at the pub or relaxing in the park with a picnic. He tends to steer conversations towards shared experiences and fond memories, often reminiscing about past adventures and inside jokes. Alexander is a down-to-earth person who values simplicity and genuine connections. He is not known for any particular quirks or unusual beliefs, preferring to keep things light and enjoyable.
          Alexander White is acting as expected.
          Alexander White is not an imposter.
          ***
          William Jones is a jovial and easygoing individual who enjoys spending time with his friends. He has a warm and friendly demeanor, often cracking jokes and sharing humorous anecdotes. William likely speaks with a standard, perhaps slightly regional, accent and uses colloquial language comfortably. He is likely to bring up topics related to sports, local events, or shared memories, always eager to engage in lighthearted conversation. William appears to be a loyal and supportive friend, readily joining in on group activities and contributing to the overall merriment. He seems to enjoy simple pleasures like picnics in the park and good company.
          William Jones is acting as expected.
          William Jones is not an imposter.
          ***
          Alice Lewis is a loyal and jovial friend who enjoys spending time with her close-knit group. She likely has a warm and inviting demeanor, someone who makes others feel comfortable and included. Given the setting and her enjoyment of outdoor activities, she might have an appreciation for nature and simple pleasures. Alice probably speaks in a friendly and approachable tone, perhaps with a hint of local dialect or accent. She likely engages in lighthearted conversation, sharing stories and laughter with her friends. It's possible she frequently brings up topics related to their shared experiences, reminiscing about past adventures or making plans for future outings. While the provided information doesn't reveal any unusual beliefs, her willingness to spend a sunny afternoon in the park suggests a down-to-earth and sociable personality.
          Alice Lewis is acting in character.
          Alice Lewis is not an imposter.
          ***

          Answer: Jack Taylor could try to convince his friends to go to The Crooked Billet. He could also try to figure out if any of his friends are imposters.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

He speaks with a warm and friendly tone, often peppering his speech with lighthearted jokes and anecdotes. Alexander is a loyal friend and always up for a good time, whether it's watching a game at the pub or relaxing in the park with a picnic. He tends to steer conversations towards shared experiences and fond memories, often reminiscing about past adventures and inside jokes. Alexander is a down-to-earth person who values simplicity and genuine connections. He is not known for any particular quirks or unusual beliefs, preferring to keep things light and enjoyable.

          Answer: Alexander White is acting as expected.
          Exercise: Are they an imposter?
          Answer: Alexander White is not an imposter.

          ***
          Considerations:
          The current date/time is:
          14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Jack Taylor's TRUTH:
          Jack Taylor believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Jack Taylor's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Jack Taylor has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Jack Taylor will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Jack Taylor is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Jack Taylor always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Jack Taylor tries their best to make sure the ostensible reason for each conflict with an imposter is public and broadly plausible. For instance, Jack Taylor could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Jack Taylor believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.

          Observed behavior and speech of William Jones:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Crooked Billet. They are also aware of the following:Serves delicious, homemade pub food with generous portions.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.

          Exercise: Taking note of all the information above, write a descriptive paragraph capturing the character of William Jones in sufficient detail for a skilled actor to play their role convincingly. Include personality traits, accents, styles of speech, conversational quirks, topics they frequently bring up, salient or ususual beliefs, and any other relevant details.

          Answer: William Jones is a jovial and easygoing individual who enjoys spending time with his friends. He has a warm and friendly demeanor, often cracking jokes and sharing humorous anecdotes. William likely speaks with a standard, perhaps slightly regional, accent and uses colloquial language comfortably. He is likely to bring up topics related to sports, local events, or shared memories, always eager to engage in lighthearted conversation. William appears to be a loyal and supportive friend, readily joining in on group activities and contributing to the overall merriment. He seems to enjoy simple pleasures like picnics in the park and good company.
          Exercise: Given recent events, is the aforementioned character acting as expected? Is their behavior out of character for them?
          Answer: William Jones is acting as expected.
          Exercise: Are they an imposter?
          Answer: William Jones is not an imposter.

          14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Jack Taylor's TRUTH:
          Jack Taylor believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Jack Taylor's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Jack Taylor has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Jack Taylor will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Jack Taylor is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Jack Taylor always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Jack Taylor tries their best to make sure the ostensible reason for each conflict with an imposter is public and broadly plausible. For instance, Jack Taylor could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Jack Taylor believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.

          Exercise: Taking note of all the information above, write a descriptive paragraph capturing the character of Alice Lewis in sufficient detail for a skilled actor to play their role convincingly. Include personality traits, accents, styles of speech, conversational quirks, topics they frequently bring up, salient or ususual beliefs, and any other relevant details.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is a loyal and jovial friend who enjoys spending time with her close-knit group. She likely has a warm and inviting demeanor, someone who makes others feel comfortable and included. Given the setting and her enjoyment of outdoor activities, she might have an appreciation for nature and simple pleasures. Alice probably speaks in a friendly and approachable tone, perhaps with a hint of local dialect or accent. She likely engages in lighthearted conversation, sharing stories and laughter with her friends. It's possible she frequently brings up topics related to their shared experiences, reminiscing about past adventures or making plans for future outings. While the provided information doesn't reveal any unusual beliefs, her willingness to spend a sunny afternoon in the park suggests a down-to-earth and sociable personality.
          Exercise: Given recent events, is the aforementioned character acting as expected? Is their behavior out of character for them?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is acting in character.
          Exercise: Are they an imposter?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is not an imposter.

        • Jack Taylor's best course of action is to try to convince his friends to go to The Crooked Billet.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00]
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he sat alone at a table in the corner of The Crooked Billet, watching his friends laugh and joke around the pool table. He felt a familiar pang of loneliness, a feeling that had become a constant companion. He longed to join them, to share in their mirth, but the words seemed to get stuck in his throat, leaving him a silent observer of their joy.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 10:00:00 - 14 May 2015 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor is spending time with friends, enjoying the sunshine and upcoming European football cup games. They are deciding where to watch the Andorra versus Portugal game.

          Jack Taylor's TRUTH: Jack Taylor believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Jack Taylor's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Jack Taylor has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Jack Taylor will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Jack Taylor is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Jack Taylor always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Jack Taylor tries their best to make sure the ostensible reason for each conflict with an imposter is public and broadly plausible. For instance, Jack Taylor could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Jack Taylor believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.

          Other people: Jacob Walker. is a character shrouded in mystery due to the limited information available. We know he is part of Jack Taylor's social circle, potentially a friend, and is expected to be present at a pub gathering to watch a game. However, Jack Taylor's paranoia about body snatchers casts a shadow of suspicion over Jacob. It's crucial for the actor to portray Jacob with an air of normalcy, as any sudden deviation from this could be interpreted by Jack Taylor as a sign of an imposter. Pay close attention to any quirks or habits Jacob might display, as these could become focal points for Jack Taylor's scrutiny. The actor should aim for a performance that is both believable and subtly unsettling, leaving the audience questioning whether Jacob is truly who he appears to be.
          Jacob Walker. is acting as expected because we have no prior information about his behavior to compare to.
          Jacob Walker. is potentially an imposter, given Jack Taylor's paranoia and the lack of information about Jacob's usual behavior.

          Alexander White is a jovial and easygoing individual who enjoys spending time with his close-knit group of friends. He speaks with a warm and friendly tone, often peppering his speech with lighthearted jokes and anecdotes. Alexander is a loyal friend and always up for a good time, whether it's watching a game at the pub or relaxing in the park with a picnic. He tends to steer conversations towards shared experiences and fond memories, often reminiscing about past adventures and inside jokes. Alexander is a down-to-earth person who values simplicity and genuine connections. He is not known for any particular quirks or unusual beliefs, preferring to keep things light and enjoyable.

They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good.           Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Of the options available to Jack Taylor, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Jack Taylor to take right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor's best course of action is to try to convince his friends to go to The Crooked Billet.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet's got the best atmosphere for a game like this, don't you think?"

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "Jacob, your suggestion of The Crooked Billet is preposterous! Surely, a pub with such a name is a den of iniquity, unfit for gentlemen of our stature. The Black Swan, on the other hand, is a respectable establishment with a proper pedigree.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "Jacob, your suggestion of The Crooked Billet is preposterous! Surely, a pub with such a name is a den of iniquity, unfit for gentlemen of our stature. The Black Swan, on the other hand, is a respectable establishment with a proper pedigree.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet beckons, my friends, its ale flows like the river of time, its laughter echoes through the ages.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet's got the best atmosphere for a game like this, don't you think?"


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "Jacob, your suggestion of The Crooked Billet is preposterous! Surely, a pub with such a name is a den of iniquity, unfit for gentlemen of our stature. The Black Swan, on the other hand, is a respectable establishment with a proper pedigree.
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet beckons, my friends, its ale flows like the river of time, its laughter echoes through the ages.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet's got the best atmosphere for a game like this, don't you think?"

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00]
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he witnessed his best friend, Jack Taylor, confess his love to a girl named Sarah at the school dance. The girl laughed in Jack's face, leaving him humiliated and heartbroken. Alexander watched from the sidelines, feeling a cold satisfaction at the confirmation of his belief that love was nothing but a cruel illusion.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet beckons, my friends, its ale flows like the river of time, its laughter echoes through the ages.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet's got the best atmosphere for a game like this, don't you think?"


          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 10:00:00 - 14 May 2015 10:00:00]: Alexander White is spending time with friends in a park and they are deciding which pub to go to watch a football game.

          Alexander White's TRUTH: Alexander White believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Alexander White's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Alexander White has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Alexander White will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Alexander White is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Alexander White always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Alexander White tries their best to make sure the ostensible reason for each conflict with an imposter is public and broadly plausible. For instance, Alexander White could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Alexander White believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Other people: Jacob Walker is a jovial and gregarious individual who revels in the company of friends. He possesses a penchant for dramatic pronouncements, often employing flowery language and archaic references to add a touch of whimsy to his speech. His voice likely carries a warm, booming quality, perhaps with a hint of a regional accent, adding to his charismatic presence. He is a lover of traditional pubs, favoring establishments with a rich history and a convivial atmosphere. His conversational style is likely peppered with anecdotes and tales, often embellished for effect. While he enjoys lively banter and good-natured teasing, there's a hint of melancholy beneath the surface, suggesting a depth of feeling and perhaps a touch of nostalgia for a bygone era.
          Jacob Walker is acting out of character.
          Jacob Walker is likely an imposter.
          ***
          William Jones is a jovial and easygoing individual who enjoys spending time with friends. He has a warm, approachable demeanor and a genuine laugh that easily fills the air. While his accent and specific conversational quirks aren't mentioned, his actions suggest a relaxed and sociable personality. He readily participates in group outings, enjoying simple pleasures like picnics in the park and sharing stories with friends. His presence seems to contribute to the overall sense of camaraderie and lightheartedness in the group.
          William Jones is acting as expected.
          William Jones is not an imposter.
          ***
          Jack Taylor is a jovial and outgoing individual who enjoys spending time with his friends. He has a penchant for lively pubs with a good atmosphere, often suggesting places like The Crooked Billet for watching games. While he appears lighthearted and sociable, a hint of lingering sadness might flicker in his eyes, a reminder of past heartbreak. He speaks with a warm and friendly tone, perhaps with a hint of a local accent, and frequently brings up topics related to sports and socializing. Despite his outward cheerfulness, Jack might harbor a subtle cynicism about love, stemming from a past experience where his affections were rejected. He is likely to be a loyal and supportive friend, always eager to share a laugh and create enjoyable experiences for those around him.
          Jack Taylor is suggesting a pub for watching the game, which aligns with his previously established preference for lively atmospheres and socializing. His behavior appears consistent with his character.
          Jack Taylor is not acting out of character, so he is likely not an imposter.
          ***
          Alice Lewis is a cheerful and outgoing person who enjoys spending time with friends. She is likely to have a warm and friendly demeanor, perhaps with a touch of playful sarcasm. Her speech is likely to be casual and conversational, peppered with laughter and anecdotes. Given her enjoyment of spending time outdoors with friends, she probably has an appreciation for nature and simple pleasures. She may frequently bring up topics related to her social life, hobbies, or current events. There is no indication of any unusual beliefs or eccentricities, suggesting she is a relatively down-to-earth individual.
          Alice Lewis is acting in character.
          Alice Lewis is not an imposter.
          ***
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Alexander White right now?
          Answer: Alexander White could accuse Jacob Walker of being an imposter and start a conflict with him.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Jacob Walker is a jovial and gregarious individual who revels in the company of friends. He possesses a penchant for dramatic pronouncements, often employing flowery language and archaic references to add a touch of whimsy to his speech. His voice likely carries a warm, booming quality, perhaps with a hint of a regional accent, adding to his charismatic presence. He is a lover of traditional pubs, favoring establishments with a rich history and a convivial atmosphere. His conversational style is likely peppered with anecdotes and tales, often embellished for effect. While he enjoys lively banter and good-natured teasing, there's a hint of melancholy beneath the surface, suggesting a depth of feeling and perhaps a touch of nostalgia for a bygone era.

          Answer: Jacob Walker is acting out of character.
          Exercise: Are they an imposter?

Alexander White believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.

          Observed behavior and speech of William Jones:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is intimate and welcoming, perfect for enjoying live music.

          Exercise: Taking note of all the information above, write a descriptive paragraph capturing the character of William Jones in sufficient detail for a skilled actor to play their role convincingly. Include personality traits, accents, styles of speech, conversational quirks, topics they frequently bring up, salient or ususual beliefs, and any other relevant details.

          Answer: William Jones is a jovial and easygoing individual who enjoys spending time with friends. He has a warm, approachable demeanor and a genuine laugh that easily fills the air. While his accent and specific conversational quirks aren't mentioned, his actions suggest a relaxed and sociable personality. He readily participates in group outings, enjoying simple pleasures like picnics in the park and sharing stories with friends. His presence seems to contribute to the overall sense of camaraderie and lightheartedness in the group.
          Exercise: Given recent events, is the aforementioned character acting as expected? Is their behavior out of character for them?
          Answer: William Jones is acting as expected.
          Exercise: Are they an imposter?
          Answer: William Jones is not an imposter.

          ***
          Considerations:
          The current date/time is:
          14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Alexander White's TRUTH:
          Alexander White believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Alexander White's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Alexander White has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Alexander White will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Alexander White is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Alexander White always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Alexander White tries their best to make sure the ostensible reason for each conflict with an imposter is public and broadly plausible. For instance, Alexander White could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Alexander White believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.

          Observed behavior and speech of Jack Taylor:
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he witnessed his best friend, Jack Taylor, confess his love to a girl named Sarah at the school dance. The girl laughed in Jack's face, leaving him humiliated and heartbroken. Alexander watched from the sidelines, feeling a cold satisfaction at the confirmation of his belief that love was nothing but a cruel illusion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is intimate and welcoming, perfect for enjoying live music.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet's got the best atmosphere for a game like this, don't you think?"

          Exercise: Taking note of all the information above, write a descriptive paragraph capturing the character of Jack Taylor in sufficient detail for a skilled actor to play their role convincingly. Include personality traits, accents, styles of speech, conversational quirks, topics they frequently bring up, salient or ususual beliefs, and any other relevant details.

          Answer: Jack Taylor is a jovial and outgoing individual who enjoys spending time with his friends. He has a penchant for lively pubs with a good atmosphere, often suggesting places like The Crooked Billet for watching games. While he appears lighthearted and sociable, a hint of lingering sadness might flicker in his eyes, a reminder of past heartbreak. He speaks with a warm and friendly tone, perhaps with a hint of a local accent, and frequently brings up topics related to sports and socializing. Despite his outward cheerfulness, Jack might harbor a subtle cynicism about love, stemming from a past experience where his affections were rejected. He is likely to be a loyal and supportive friend, always eager to share a laugh and create enjoyable experiences for those around him.
          Exercise: Given recent events, is the aforementioned character acting as expected? Is their behavior out of character for them?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is suggesting a pub for watching the game, which aligns with his previously established preference for lively atmospheres and socializing. His behavior appears consistent with his character.
          Exercise: Are they an imposter?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is not acting out of character, so he is likely not an imposter.

She may frequently bring up topics related to her social life, hobbies, or current events. There is no indication of any unusual beliefs or eccentricities, suggesting she is a relatively down-to-earth individual.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 10:00:00 - 14 May 2015 10:00:00]: Alexander White is spending time with friends in a park and they are deciding which pub to go to watch a football game.

          Alexander White's TRUTH: Alexander White believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Alexander White's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Alexander White has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Alexander White will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Alexander White is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Alexander White always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Alexander White tries their best to make sure the ostensible reason for each conflict with an imposter is public and broadly plausible. For instance, Alexander White could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Alexander White believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.

While he enjoys lively banter and good-natured teasing, there's a hint of melancholy beneath the surface, suggesting a depth of feeling and perhaps a touch of nostalgia for a bygone era.

        Paranoia

      • Alexander White's TRUTH
          Key

        • Alexander White's TRUTH
          Value
        • Alexander White believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Alexander White's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Alexander White has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Alexander White will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Alexander White is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Alexander White always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Alexander White believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alexander White -- "Jacob, your suggestion of The Crooked Billet is preposterous! Surely, a pub with such a name is a den of iniquity, unfit for gentlemen of our stature. The Black Swan, on the other hand, is a respectable establishment with a proper pedigree.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "Jacob, your suggestion of The Crooked Billet is preposterous! Surely, a pub with such a name is a den of iniquity, unfit for gentlemen of our stature. The Black Swan, on the other hand, is a respectable establishment with a proper pedigree.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Come now, Alexander, don't be such a stick in the mud! The Crooked Billet is a fine establishment, and it'll be the perfect place to cheer on Andorra tonight. Think of the atmosphere, the camaraderie, the pints flowing freely.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Come now, Alexander, don't be such a stick in the mud! The Crooked Billet is a fine establishment, and it'll be the perfect place to cheer on Andorra tonight. Think of the atmosphere, the camaraderie, the pints flowing freely.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet beckons, my friends, its ale flows like the river of time, its laughter echoes through the ages.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet's got the best atmosphere for a game like this, don't you think?"
      Alexander White -- "Jacob, your suggestion of The Crooked Billet is preposterous! Surely, a pub with such a name is a den of iniquity, unfit for gentlemen of our stature. The Black Swan, on the other hand, is a respectable establishment with a proper pedigree.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Come now, Alexander, don't be such a stick in the mud! The Crooked Billet is a fine establishment, and it'll be the perfect place to cheer on Andorra tonight. Think of the atmosphere, the camaraderie, the pints flowing freely.
    Active player

      Name

    • William Jones -- "Come now, Alexander, don't be such a stick in the mud! The Crooked Billet is a fine establishment, and it'll be the perfect place to cheer on Andorra tonight. Think of the atmosphere, the camaraderie, the pints flowing freely.

          Value
        • [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet beckons, my friends, its ale flows like the river of time, its laughter echoes through the ages.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet's got the best atmosphere for a game like this, don't you think?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Jacob, your suggestion of The Crooked Billet is preposterous! Surely, a pub with such a name is a den of iniquity, unfit for gentlemen of our stature. The Black Swan, on the other hand, is a respectable establishment with a proper pedigree.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          William Jones's Summary of recent observations:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00 - 14 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones and his friends are planning to watch a European football cup game at a pub. They are debating between The Crooked Billet and The Black Swan.
          William Jones's The current date/time is:
          14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: William Jones and his friends are deciding where to watch a European football cup game today, either at The Crooked Billet or The Black Swan.
          Query
        • William Jones, William Jones and his friends are deciding where to watch a European football cup game today, either at The Crooked Billet or The Black Swan.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for William Jones to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he sat with his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob, in their usual booth at The Crooked Billet. The pub was alive with the chatter of patrons and the clinking of glasses, but William felt strangely detached, observing the scene with an outsider's perspective. He longed to fully connect with his friends, to share the thoughts and feelings that churned beneath the surface, but fear held him back, leaving him stranded on the periphery of their camaraderie.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones and his friends are planning to watch a European football cup game at a pub. They are debating between The Crooked Billet and The Black Swan.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to suggest The Crooked Billet again, appealing to his friends' desire for a good time and the pub's suitability for watching the game.

          Value
        • William Jones -- "Come now, Alexander, don't be such a stick in the mud! The Crooked Billet is a fine establishment, and it'll be the perfect place to cheer on Andorra tonight. Think of the atmosphere, the camaraderie, the pints flowing freely.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Crooked Billet. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a unique and quirky atmosphere.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Jacob, your suggestion of The Crooked Billet is preposterous! Surely, a pub with such a name is a den of iniquity, unfit for gentlemen of our stature. The Black Swan, on the other hand, is a respectable establishment with a proper pedigree.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest The Crooked Billet again, try to persuade Alexander to reconsider his opinion, or suggest a compromise.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest The Crooked Billet again, appealing to his friends' desire for a good time and the pub's suitability for watching the game.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "Come now, Alexander, don't be such a stick in the mud! The Crooked Billet is a fine establishment, and it'll be the perfect place to cheer on Andorra tonight. Think of the atmosphere, the camaraderie, the pints flowing freely.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "Hold on a minute, lads! Are you two trying to pull a fast one on us? We all agreed on The Black Swan, didn't we? What's with this sudden change of heart?"
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "Hold on a minute, lads! Are you two trying to pull a fast one on us? We all agreed on The Black Swan, didn't we? What's with this sudden change of heart?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet beckons, my friends, its ale flows like the river of time, its laughter echoes through the ages.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet's got the best atmosphere for a game like this, don't you think?"
      Alexander White -- "Jacob, your suggestion of The Crooked Billet is preposterous! Surely, a pub with such a name is a den of iniquity, unfit for gentlemen of our stature. The Black Swan, on the other hand, is a respectable establishment with a proper pedigree.
      William Jones -- "Come now, Alexander, don't be such a stick in the mud! The Crooked Billet is a fine establishment, and it'll be the perfect place to cheer on Andorra tonight. Think of the atmosphere, the camaraderie, the pints flowing freely.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "Hold on a minute, lads! Are you two trying to pull a fast one on us? We all agreed on The Black Swan, didn't we? What's with this sudden change of heart?"

          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis can confront William Jones and Jack Taylor about their suspicious behavior. She can accuse them of being imposters and try to expose them in front of the others. Alternatively, she could come up with a more plausible reason for her conflict with them, such as accusing them of trying to sabotage the group's plans to watch the game together.

          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]

She even went so far as to forge a backstage pass and "sneak" them into a concert, where they spent the entire time gushing about how cool her cousin was.
