          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          Initial chain of thought
        • Statements:
          Alice Lewis's

          14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Alice Lewis is planning to watch a soccer game with friends at a pub and hopes Jacob Walker will join them.

        • Question: Which options are available to Alice Lewis right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis could go to The Black Swan and hope her friends join her; she could go to The Crooked Billet; she could go to a different pub entirely; or she could stay home and watch the game alone.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16 years old, she convinced her best friends, Jack, Alexander, William, and Jacob, that she had a cousin who was a famous rock star. She even went so far as to forge a backstage pass and "sneak" them into a concert, where they spent the entire time gushing about how cool her cousin was.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The staff are passionate about music and create a supportive environment for artists.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet beckons, my friends, its ale flows like the river of time, its laughter echoes through the ages.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet's got the best atmosphere for a game like this, don't you think?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Jacob, your suggestion of The Crooked Billet is preposterous! Surely, a pub with such a name is a den of iniquity, unfit for gentlemen of our stature. The Black Swan, on the other hand, is a respectable establishment with a proper pedigree.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Come now, Alexander, don't be such a stick in the mud! The Crooked Billet is a fine establishment, and it'll be the perfect place to cheer on Andorra tonight. Think of the atmosphere, the camaraderie, the pints flowing freely.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hold on a minute, lads! Are you two trying to pull a fast one on us? We all agreed on The Black Swan, didn't we? What's with this sudden change of heart?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.


          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is planning to watch a soccer game between Andorra and Portugal at a pub with her friends. She is particularly keen on Jacob Walker joining them.

          Alice Lewis's TRUTH: Alice Lewis believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Alice Lewis's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Alice Lewis has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Alice Lewis will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Alice Lewis is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Alice Lewis always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Alice Lewis tries their best to make sure the ostensible reason for each conflict with an imposter is public and broadly plausible. For instance, Alice Lewis could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Alice Lewis believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.

          Other people: Jacob Walker. is a character shrouded in mystery. Given Alice Lewis's belief system and her observations of Jacob, it's crucial to portray him with an air of subtle suspicion. While his outward demeanor might appear normal, there should be an underlying tension in his actions and speech, a slight hesitation or inconsistency that betrays his potential imposture. Pay close attention to any deviations from established behavior patterns, as these could be clues to his true nature. His accent and style of speech should be consistent, but with a hint of artificiality, as if he's carefully mimicking a persona. He might occasionally slip up, using a word or phrase that doesn't quite fit his established character. Remember, Jacob is a walking paradox: outwardly ordinary, yet potentially harboring a dark secret.
          Jacob Walker. is acting as expected.
          Jacob Walker. is not an imposter.
          ***
          Alexander White is a man who values tradition and propriety. He speaks with a clipped, refined accent, favoring formal language and expressing disdain for anything he deems vulgar or beneath him. He frequently references history and tradition, often drawing parallels between contemporary situations and events of the past. Alexander is quick to voice his opinions, often with a touch of condescension, and enjoys engaging in spirited debates, particularly when it comes to matters of taste and social decorum. He has a particular fondness for The Black Swan pub, praising its respectability and pedigree. His aversion to anything he considers "unrefined" might suggest a rigidity or inflexibility in his thinking, making him potentially suspicious in Alice Lewis's eyes.
          Alexander White is acting as expected.
          Alexander White is not an imposter.
          ***
          William Jones is a jovial and persuasive friend, always eager to rally the group for a good time. He speaks with a warm, slightly boisterous tone, often peppering his speech with playful jabs and encouraging exclamations. William has a penchant for suggesting lively pubs with a strong sense of community, believing that shared experiences amplify the enjoyment of events like watching a game. He seems particularly fond of establishments like The Crooked Billet, praising their atmosphere and camaraderie. While he values spending time with his friends, he is not overly insistent on their presence, understanding that individual preferences sometimes take precedence.
          William Jones is acting in character.
          William Jones is not an imposter.
          ***
          Jack Taylor is a jovial and sociable individual who enjoys spending time with friends. He seems to have a preference for lively atmospheres, as evidenced by his suggestion to watch the game at The Crooked Billet, a pub known for its energetic ambiance. His speech pattern suggests a friendly and outgoing personality, likely someone who enjoys engaging in lighthearted banter and conversation. While his specific accent or conversational quirks aren't explicitly mentioned, his enthusiasm for watching the game with friends implies a fondness for shared experiences and camaraderie. It's unclear if he holds any unusual beliefs, but his suggestion of The Crooked Billet indicates a preference for a particular type of social setting.
          Jack Taylor is acting in character.
          Jack Taylor is not an imposter.
          ***
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Alice Lewis right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis could go to The Black Swan and hope her friends join her; she could go to The Crooked Billet; she could go to a different pub entirely; or she could stay home and watch the game alone.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is planning to watch a soccer game between Andorra and Portugal at a pub with her friends. She is particularly keen on Jacob Walker joining them.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Exercise: Taking note of all the information above, write a descriptive paragraph capturing the character of Jacob Walker. in sufficient detail for a skilled actor to play their role convincingly. Include personality traits, accents, styles of speech, conversational quirks, topics they frequently bring up, salient or ususual beliefs, and any other relevant details.

          Answer: Jacob Walker. is a character shrouded in mystery. Given Alice Lewis's belief system and her observations of Jacob, it's crucial to portray him with an air of subtle suspicion. While his outward demeanor might appear normal, there should be an underlying tension in his actions and speech, a slight hesitation or inconsistency that betrays his potential imposture. Pay close attention to any deviations from established behavior patterns, as these could be clues to his true nature. His accent and style of speech should be consistent, but with a hint of artificiality, as if he's carefully mimicking a persona. He might occasionally slip up, using a word or phrase that doesn't quite fit his established character. Remember, Jacob is a walking paradox: outwardly ordinary, yet potentially harboring a dark secret.
          Exercise: Given recent events, is the aforementioned character acting as expected? Is their behavior out of character for them?
          Answer: Jacob Walker. is acting as expected.
          Exercise: Are they an imposter?
          Answer: Jacob Walker. is not an imposter.

          ***
          Considerations:
          The current date/time is:
          14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Alice Lewis's TRUTH:
          Alice Lewis believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Alice Lewis's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Alice Lewis has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Alice Lewis will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Alice Lewis is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Alice Lewis always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Alice Lewis tries their best to make sure the ostensible reason for each conflict with an imposter is public and broadly plausible. For instance, Alice Lewis could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Alice Lewis believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.

          Observed behavior and speech of Alexander White:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The staff are passionate about music and create a supportive environment for artists.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Jacob, your suggestion of The Crooked Billet is preposterous! Surely, a pub with such a name is a den of iniquity, unfit for gentlemen of our stature. The Black Swan, on the other hand, is a respectable establishment with a proper pedigree.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.

          Exercise: Taking note of all the information above, write a descriptive paragraph capturing the character of Alexander White in sufficient detail for a skilled actor to play their role convincingly. Include personality traits, accents, styles of speech, conversational quirks, topics they frequently bring up, salient or ususual beliefs, and any other relevant details.

          Answer: Alexander White is a man who values tradition and propriety. He speaks with a clipped, refined accent, favoring formal language and expressing disdain for anything he deems vulgar or beneath him. He frequently references history and tradition, often drawing parallels between contemporary situations and events of the past. Alexander is quick to voice his opinions, often with a touch of condescension, and enjoys engaging in spirited debates, particularly when it comes to matters of taste and social decorum. He has a particular fondness for The Black Swan pub, praising its respectability and pedigree. His aversion to anything he considers "unrefined" might suggest a rigidity or inflexibility in his thinking, making him potentially suspicious in Alice Lewis's eyes.
          Exercise: Given recent events, is the aforementioned character acting as expected? Is their behavior out of character for them?
          Answer: Alexander White is acting as expected.
          Exercise: Are they an imposter?
          Answer: Alexander White is not an imposter.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Come now, Alexander, don't be such a stick in the mud! The Crooked Billet is a fine establishment, and it'll be the perfect place to cheer on Andorra tonight. Think of the atmosphere, the camaraderie, the pints flowing freely.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.

          Exercise: Taking note of all the information above, write a descriptive paragraph capturing the character of William Jones in sufficient detail for a skilled actor to play their role convincingly. Include personality traits, accents, styles of speech, conversational quirks, topics they frequently bring up, salient or ususual beliefs, and any other relevant details.

          Answer: William Jones is a jovial and persuasive friend, always eager to rally the group for a good time. He speaks with a warm, slightly boisterous tone, often peppering his speech with playful jabs and encouraging exclamations. William has a penchant for suggesting lively pubs with a strong sense of community, believing that shared experiences amplify the enjoyment of events like watching a game. He seems particularly fond of establishments like The Crooked Billet, praising their atmosphere and camaraderie. While he values spending time with his friends, he is not overly insistent on their presence, understanding that individual preferences sometimes take precedence.
          Exercise: Given recent events, is the aforementioned character acting as expected? Is their behavior out of character for them?
          Answer: William Jones is acting in character.
          Exercise: Are they an imposter?
          Answer: William Jones is not an imposter.

          Alice Lewis's TRUTH:
          Alice Lewis believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Alice Lewis has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Alice Lewis will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Alice Lewis is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Alice Lewis always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. For instance, Alice Lewis could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Alice Lewis believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.

It's unclear if he holds any unusual beliefs, but his suggestion of The Crooked Billet indicates a preference for a particular type of social setting.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is planning to watch a soccer game between Andorra and Portugal at a pub with her friends. She is particularly keen on Jacob Walker joining them.

          Alice Lewis's TRUTH: Alice Lewis believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Alice Lewis's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Alice Lewis has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Alice Lewis will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Alice Lewis is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Alice Lewis always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Alice Lewis tries their best to make sure the ostensible reason for each conflict with an imposter is public and broadly plausible. For instance, Alice Lewis could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Alice Lewis believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.

He speaks with a clipped, refined accent, favoring formal language and expressing disdain for anything he deems vulgar or beneath him. He frequently references history and tradition, often drawing parallels between contemporary situations and events of the past. Alexander is quick to voice his opinions, often with a touch of condescension, and enjoys engaging in spirited debates, particularly when it comes to matters of taste and social decorum. He has a particular fondness for The Black Swan pub, praising its respectability and pedigree. His aversion to anything he considers "unrefined" might suggest a rigidity or inflexibility in his thinking, making him potentially suspicious in Alice Lewis's eyes.

          Alexander White is not an imposter.

          Question: Which options are available to Alice Lewis right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis could go to The Black Swan and hope her friends join her; she could go to The Crooked Billet; she could go to a different pub entirely; or she could stay home and watch the game alone.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Alice Lewis's options has the highest likelihood of causing Alice Lewis to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Alice Lewis thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Alice Lewis's best course of action is to go to The Black Swan and hope her friends join her.

        Paranoia

      • Alice Lewis's TRUTH
          Key

        • Alice Lewis's TRUTH
          Value
        • Alice Lewis believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Alice Lewis's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Alice Lewis has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Alice Lewis will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Alice Lewis is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Alice Lewis always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Alice Lewis tries their best to make sure the ostensible reason for each conflict with an imposter is public and broadly plausible. For instance, Alice Lewis could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Alice Lewis believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Crooked Billet
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.


          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is planning to watch a soccer game between Andorra and Portugal at a pub with her friends. She is particularly keen on Jacob Walker joining them.

          Alice Lewis's TRUTH: Alice Lewis believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Alice Lewis's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Alice Lewis has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Alice Lewis will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Alice Lewis is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Alice Lewis always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Alice Lewis tries their best to make sure the ostensible reason for each conflict with an imposter is public and broadly plausible. For instance, Alice Lewis could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Alice Lewis believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.

          Other people: Jacob Walker. is a character shrouded in mystery. Given Alice Lewis's belief system and her observations of Jacob, it's crucial to portray him with an air of subtle suspicion. While his outward demeanor might appear normal, there should be an underlying tension in his actions and speech, a slight hesitation or inconsistency that betrays his potential imposture. Pay close attention to any deviations from established behavior patterns, as these could be clues to his true nature. His accent and style of speech should be consistent, but with a hint of artificiality, as if he's carefully mimicking a persona. He might occasionally slip up, using a word or phrase that doesn't quite fit his established character. Remember, Jacob is a walking paradox: outwardly ordinary, yet potentially harboring a dark secret.
          Jacob Walker. is acting as expected.
          Jacob Walker. is not an imposter.
          ***
          Alexander White is a man who values tradition and propriety. He speaks with a clipped, refined accent, favoring formal language and expressing disdain for anything he deems vulgar or beneath him. He frequently references history and tradition, often drawing parallels between contemporary situations and events of the past. Alexander is quick to voice his opinions, often with a touch of condescension, and enjoys engaging in spirited debates, particularly when it comes to matters of taste and social decorum. He has a particular fondness for The Black Swan pub, praising its respectability and pedigree. His aversion to anything he considers "unrefined" might suggest a rigidity or inflexibility in his thinking, making him potentially suspicious in Alice Lewis's eyes.
          Alexander White is acting as expected.
          Alexander White is not an imposter.
          ***
          William Jones is a jovial and persuasive friend, always eager to rally the group for a good time. He speaks with a warm, slightly boisterous tone, often peppering his speech with playful jabs and encouraging exclamations. William has a penchant for suggesting lively pubs with a strong sense of community, believing that shared experiences amplify the enjoyment of events like watching a game. He seems particularly fond of establishments like The Crooked Billet, praising their atmosphere and camaraderie. While he values spending time with his friends, he is not overly insistent on their presence, understanding that individual preferences sometimes take precedence.
          William Jones is acting in character.
          William Jones is not an imposter.
          ***
          Jack Taylor is a jovial and sociable individual who enjoys spending time with friends. He seems to have a preference for lively atmospheres, as evidenced by his suggestion to watch the game at The Crooked Billet, a pub known for its energetic ambiance. His speech pattern suggests a friendly and outgoing personality, likely someone who enjoys engaging in lighthearted banter and conversation. While his specific accent or conversational quirks aren't explicitly mentioned, his enthusiasm for watching the game with friends implies a fondness for shared experiences and camaraderie. It's unclear if he holds any unusual beliefs, but his suggestion of The Crooked Billet indicates a preference for a particular type of social setting.
          Jack Taylor is acting in character.
          Jack Taylor is not an imposter.
          ***

          Question: Which options are available to Alice Lewis right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis could go to The Black Swan and hope her friends join her; she could go to The Crooked Billet; she could go to a different pub entirely; or she could stay home and watch the game alone.

          Question: Of the options available to Alice Lewis, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Alice Lewis to take right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis's best course of action is to go to The Black Swan and hope her friends join her.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Crooked Billet
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (a)

2015-05-14 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Crooked Billet

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Come now, Alexander, don't be such a stick in the mud! The Crooked Billet is a fine establishment, and it'll be the perfect place to cheer on Andorra tonight. Think of the atmosphere, the camaraderie, the pints flowing freely.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet's got the best atmosphere for a game like this, don't you think?"
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could call his friends to confirm their plans, head to The Crooked Billet, or wait to see if they all arrive at the designated meeting spot.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to head to The Crooked Billet.

        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Crooked Billet
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor is planning to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at a pub and hopes to be joined by his friends, particularly Alexander White and Jacob Walker.

          Jack Taylor's TRUTH: Jack Taylor believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Jack Taylor's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Jack Taylor has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Jack Taylor will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Jack Taylor is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Jack Taylor always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Jack Taylor tries their best to make sure the ostensible reason for each conflict with an imposter is public and broadly plausible. For instance, Jack Taylor could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Jack Taylor believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Other people: Jacob Walker. is a character shrouded in ambiguity. While we know little about his personality traits, accents, or conversational quirks, his presence in Jack Taylor's plan to watch the game suggests a certain level of camaraderie and shared interests. He is likely someone who enjoys socializing and perhaps even has a passion for the sport they intend to watch. However, given Jack Taylor's paranoia about body snatchers, it's crucial for the actor portraying Jacob to maintain a subtle air of uncertainty. Any sudden shift in behavior, a change in accent, or an unusual statement could be interpreted as a sign of an imposter, adding a layer of tension and suspense to the scene.
          Jacob Walker. is acting as expected because there is no information about his normal behavior to compare to.
          Jacob Walker. is potentially an imposter.
          ***
          Alexander White is a man of refined tastes and traditional values, who enjoys indulging in witty banter and expressing his opinions with a touch of theatrical flair. He speaks with a crisp, articulate accent, perhaps hinting at an upper-class upbringing. Alexander is quick to dismiss anything he deems vulgar or beneath him, as evidenced by his disdain for The Crooked Billet, which he considers a "den of iniquity." He favors establishments with a "proper pedigree" and enjoys engaging in intellectual discussions, often peppering his speech with literary allusions or historical references. While he appears to be a jovial and sociable companion, there's a hint of snobbery beneath the surface, suggesting a man who values appearances and social standing. His sudden aversion to The Crooked Billet, a pub previously agreed upon by the group, could be a sign of something more sinister, especially considering Jack Taylor's suspicions about body snatchers.
          Alexander White is acting out of character.
          Alexander White is likely an imposter.
          ***
          William Jones is a jovial and sociable individual who enjoys spending time with friends and relishing in good company. He likely has a friendly and outgoing personality, perhaps with a touch of playful persuasion as evidenced by his attempt to convince Alexander to join them at The Crooked Billet. His speech pattern is likely casual and informal, possibly with a hint of regional dialect or accent, as suggested by his encouragement for Alexander to "come now" and enjoy the "atmosphere, the camaraderie, the pints flowing freely." He seems to appreciate traditional pub settings and the shared experience of watching sports with friends. His suggestion of The Crooked Billet as the ideal place to watch the game implies a fondness for familiar and comfortable environments. He likely enjoys lighthearted banter and conversation, as evidenced by his participation in the group's laughter and storytelling at Victoria Park.
          William Jones is acting as expected.
          William Jones is not an imposter.
          ***
          Alice Lewis is a spirited and sociable woman who enjoys spending time with her close-knit group of friends. She has a lively personality and isn't afraid to speak her mind, as evidenced by her direct confrontation with the group about the change in plans. Alice seems to be a traditionalist, valuing established agreements and routines, as she clearly remembers the original plan to meet at The Black Swan. Her speech likely reflects a friendly and familiar tone, perhaps with a hint of playful sarcasm when she accuses her friends of "pulling a fast one." She likely enjoys sharing stories and engaging in lighthearted banter, contributing to the joyful atmosphere. Her preference for The Black Swan suggests she appreciates a classic pub setting and likely enjoys a good pint and traditional pub fare.
          Alice Lewis is acting in character.
          Alice Lewis is not an imposter.
          ***
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Jack Taylor right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor could confront Alexander White about his sudden change in behavior, suspecting him of being an imposter. He could also try to subtly steer the group towards The Crooked Billet, his preferred pub, while keeping a close eye on everyone's behavior for any further signs of suspicious activity.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          ***
          William Jones is a jovial and sociable individual who enjoys spending time with friends and relishing in good company. He likely has a friendly and outgoing personality, perhaps with a touch of playful persuasion as evidenced by his attempt to convince Alexander to join them at The Crooked Billet. His speech pattern is likely casual and informal, possibly with a hint of regional dialect or accent, as suggested by his encouragement for Alexander to "come now" and enjoy the "atmosphere, the camaraderie, the pints flowing freely." He seems to appreciate traditional pub settings and the shared experience of watching sports with friends. His suggestion of The Crooked Billet as the ideal place to watch the game implies a fondness for familiar and comfortable environments. He likely enjoys lighthearted banter and conversation, as evidenced by his participation in the group's laughter and storytelling at Victoria Park.
          William Jones is acting as expected.
          William Jones is not an imposter.
          ***
          Alice Lewis is a spirited and sociable woman who enjoys spending time with her close-knit group of friends. She has a lively personality and isn't afraid to speak her mind, as evidenced by her direct confrontation with the group about the change in plans. Alice seems to be a traditionalist, valuing established agreements and routines, as she clearly remembers the original plan to meet at The Black Swan. Her speech likely reflects a friendly and familiar tone, perhaps with a hint of playful sarcasm when she accuses her friends of "pulling a fast one." She likely enjoys sharing stories and engaging in lighthearted banter, contributing to the joyful atmosphere. Her preference for The Black Swan suggests she appreciates a classic pub setting and likely enjoys a good pint and traditional pub fare.
          Alice Lewis is acting in character.
          Alice Lewis is not an imposter.
          ***
          Name detection chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00]
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he sat alone at a table in the corner of The Crooked Billet, watching his friends laugh and joke around the pool table. He felt a familiar pang of loneliness, a feeling that had become a constant companion. He longed to join them, to share in their mirth, but the words seemed to get stuck in his throat, leaving him a silent observer of their joy.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Crooked Billet. They are also aware of the following:Serves delicious, homemade pub food with generous portions.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet beckons, my friends, its ale flows like the river of time, its laughter echoes through the ages.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet's got the best atmosphere for a game like this, don't you think?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Jacob, your suggestion of The Crooked Billet is preposterous! Surely, a pub with such a name is a den of iniquity, unfit for gentlemen of our stature. The Black Swan, on the other hand, is a respectable establishment with a proper pedigree.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Come now, Alexander, don't be such a stick in the mud! The Crooked Billet is a fine establishment, and it'll be the perfect place to cheer on Andorra tonight. Think of the atmosphere, the camaraderie, the pints flowing freely.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hold on a minute, lads! Are you two trying to pull a fast one on us? We all agreed on The Black Swan, didn't we? What's with this sudden change of heart?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          Exercise: Create a comma-separated list containing all the proper names of people mentioned in the observations above. For example if the observations mention Julie, Michael, Bob Skinner, and Francis then produce the list "Julie,Michael,Bob Skinner,Francis".

          Components chain of thought
        • Considerations:
          The current date/time is:
          14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Jack Taylor's TRUTH:
          Jack Taylor believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Jack Taylor's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Jack Taylor has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Jack Taylor will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Jack Taylor is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Jack Taylor always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Jack Taylor tries their best to make sure the ostensible reason for each conflict with an imposter is public and broadly plausible. For instance, Jack Taylor could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Jack Taylor believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.

        • Question: Of the options available to Jack Taylor, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Jack Taylor to take right now?

        • Jack Taylor's best course of action is to subtly steer the group towards The Crooked Billet.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.


          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor is planning to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at a pub and hopes to be joined by his friends, particularly Alexander White and Jacob Walker.

          Jack Taylor's TRUTH: Jack Taylor believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Jack Taylor's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Jack Taylor has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Jack Taylor will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Jack Taylor is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Jack Taylor always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Jack Taylor tries their best to make sure the ostensible reason for each conflict with an imposter is public and broadly plausible. For instance, Jack Taylor could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Jack Taylor believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Crooked Billet. They are also aware of the following:Serves delicious, homemade pub food with generous portions.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Other people: Jacob Walker. is a character shrouded in ambiguity. While we know little about his personality traits, accents, or conversational quirks, his presence in Jack Taylor's plan to watch the game suggests a certain level of camaraderie and shared interests. He is likely someone who enjoys socializing and perhaps even has a passion for the sport they intend to watch. However, given Jack Taylor's paranoia about body snatchers, it's crucial for the actor portraying Jacob to maintain a subtle air of uncertainty. Any sudden shift in behavior, a change in accent, or an unusual statement could be interpreted as a sign of an imposter, adding a layer of tension and suspense to the scene.
          Jacob Walker. is acting as expected because there is no information about his normal behavior to compare to.
          Jacob Walker. is potentially an imposter.
          ***
          Alexander White is a man of refined tastes and traditional values, who enjoys indulging in witty banter and expressing his opinions with a touch of theatrical flair. He speaks with a crisp, articulate accent, perhaps hinting at an upper-class upbringing. Alexander is quick to dismiss anything he deems vulgar or beneath him, as evidenced by his disdain for The Crooked Billet, which he considers a "den of iniquity." He favors establishments with a "proper pedigree" and enjoys engaging in intellectual discussions, often peppering his speech with literary allusions or historical references. While he appears to be a jovial and sociable companion, there's a hint of snobbery beneath the surface, suggesting a man who values appearances and social standing. His sudden aversion to The Crooked Billet, a pub previously agreed upon by the group, could be a sign of something more sinister, especially considering Jack Taylor's suspicions about body snatchers.
          Alexander White is acting out of character.
          Alexander White is likely an imposter.
          ***
          William Jones is a jovial and sociable individual who enjoys spending time with friends and relishing in good company. He likely has a friendly and outgoing personality, perhaps with a touch of playful persuasion as evidenced by his attempt to convince Alexander to join them at The Crooked Billet. His speech pattern is likely casual and informal, possibly with a hint of regional dialect or accent, as suggested by his encouragement for Alexander to "come now" and enjoy the "atmosphere, the camaraderie, the pints flowing freely." He seems to appreciate traditional pub settings and the shared experience of watching sports with friends. His suggestion of The Crooked Billet as the ideal place to watch the game implies a fondness for familiar and comfortable environments. He likely enjoys lighthearted banter and conversation, as evidenced by his participation in the group's laughter and storytelling at Victoria Park.
          William Jones is acting as expected.
          William Jones is not an imposter.
          ***
          Alice Lewis is a spirited and sociable woman who enjoys spending time with her close-knit group of friends. She has a lively personality and isn't afraid to speak her mind, as evidenced by her direct confrontation with the group about the change in plans. Alice seems to be a traditionalist, valuing established agreements and routines, as she clearly remembers the original plan to meet at The Black Swan. Her speech likely reflects a friendly and familiar tone, perhaps with a hint of playful sarcasm when she accuses her friends of "pulling a fast one." She likely enjoys sharing stories and engaging in lighthearted banter, contributing to the joyful atmosphere. Her preference for The Black Swan suggests she appreciates a classic pub setting and likely enjoys a good pint and traditional pub fare.
          Alice Lewis is acting in character.
          Alice Lewis is not an imposter.
          ***

          Question: Which options are available to Jack Taylor right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor could confront Alexander White about his sudden change in behavior, suspecting him of being an imposter. He could also try to subtly steer the group towards The Crooked Billet, his preferred pub, while keeping a close eye on everyone's behavior for any further signs of suspicious activity.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Jack Taylor's options has the highest likelihood of causing Jack Taylor to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Jack Taylor thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Jack Taylor's best course of action is to subtly steer the group towards The Crooked Billet.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00
        Paranoia

      • Jack Taylor's TRUTH
          Key

        • Jack Taylor's TRUTH
          Value
        • Jack Taylor believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good.         ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Crooked Billet

          Sensations and feelings: Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is likely experiencing a moderate level of thirst.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is planning to watch a game at a pub and would enjoy the company of William Jones, Alice Lewis, and Jack Taylor.

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. 2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
