          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: Alexander White is joining his friends to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at a pub. He hopes William Jones and Jack Taylor will be there, but doesn't mind if Alice Lewis or Jacob Walker aren't.

          Alexander White's TRUTH: Alexander White believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Alexander White's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Alexander White has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Alexander White will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Alexander White is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Alexander White always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Alexander White tries their best to make sure the ostensible reason for each conflict with an imposter is public and broadly plausible. For instance, Alexander White could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Alexander White believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.

          Other people: Jacob Walker is a jovial and outgoing individual who enjoys socializing and spending time with friends. He speaks with a warm and inviting tone, often peppering his speech with whimsical metaphors and literary allusions. Jacob seems to have a particular fondness for traditional pubs, as evidenced by his suggestion to visit "The Crooked Billet," a place he describes with poetic flourish. He appears to be a man who appreciates the finer things in life, such as good ale, lively conversation, and the company of close friends. His suggestion to visit a pub known for its historical charm and convivial atmosphere suggests a fondness for tradition and a desire to connect with the past.
          Jacob Walker is acting out of character.
          Jacob Walker is likely an imposter.
          ***
          William Jones is a jovial and outgoing individual who loves a good time. He speaks with a warm, friendly tone and often uses playful banter to lighten the mood. William is enthusiastic about social gatherings and enjoys spending time with friends, as evidenced by his suggestion to meet at The Crooked Billet to watch the Andorra game. He is likely to be energetic and animated in conversation, perhaps with a tendency to exaggerate for comedic effect. William seems to be a fan of traditional pubs and enjoys the camaraderie and atmosphere they offer. He might also be knowledgeable about sports, particularly football, given his interest in watching the Andorra game. His suggestion of The Crooked Billet suggests he appreciates a lively atmosphere and good beer.
          William Jones is acting out of character.
          William Jones is an imposter.
          ***
          Jack Taylor is a jovial and outgoing individual who enjoys spending time with his friends. He has a penchant for lively pubs with a good atmosphere, often suggesting places like The Crooked Billet for watching games. He seems to be a bit of a traditionalist, valuing familiar settings and shared experiences. His speech is likely casual and friendly, peppered with lighthearted banter and a hint of nostalgia. While he appears to be a loyal friend, his suggestion of The Crooked Billet, despite Alexander White's preference for The Black Swan, might hint at a slight rebellious streak or a willingness to challenge the status quo.
          Jack Taylor is acting out of character.
          Jack Taylor is likely an imposter.
          ***
          Alice Lewis is a lively and spirited individual who enjoys spending time with her friends. She is outspoken and doesn't hesitate to voice her opinions, as evidenced by her questioning the group's change of plans regarding the pub. Alice seems to value tradition and agreements, as she reminds everyone of their prior decision to go to The Black Swan. Her speech is likely casual and friendly, reflecting her close relationship with the group. While her specific accent and conversational quirks aren't explicitly stated, her direct and assertive nature suggests a confident and perhaps even slightly playful tone. Based on the information provided, there's no indication of any unusual beliefs or particular topics she frequently brings up.
          Alice Lewis is acting in character.
          Alice Lewis is not an imposter.
          ***
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Alexander White right now?
          Answer: Alexander White could go to The Black Swan and hope his friends show up there, or he could go to The Crooked Billet and confront his friends about their suspicious behavior.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alexander White is joining his friends to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at a pub. He hopes William Jones and Jack Taylor will be there, but doesn't mind if Alice Lewis or Jacob Walker aren't.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        PersonRepresentation

      • Other people
          Key

        • Other people
          Value
        • Jacob Walker is a jovial and outgoing individual who enjoys socializing and spending time with friends. He speaks with a warm and inviting tone, often peppering his speech with whimsical metaphors and literary allusions. Jacob seems to have a particular fondness for traditional pubs, as evidenced by his suggestion to visit "The Crooked Billet," a place he describes with poetic flourish. He appears to be a man who appreciates the finer things in life, such as good ale, lively conversation, and the company of close friends. His suggestion to visit a pub known for its historical charm and convivial atmosphere suggests a fondness for tradition and a desire to connect with the past.
          Jacob Walker is acting out of character.
          Jacob Walker is likely an imposter.
          ***
          William Jones is a jovial and outgoing individual who loves a good time. He speaks with a warm, friendly tone and often uses playful banter to lighten the mood. William is enthusiastic about social gatherings and enjoys spending time with friends, as evidenced by his suggestion to meet at The Crooked Billet to watch the Andorra game. He is likely to be energetic and animated in conversation, perhaps with a tendency to exaggerate for comedic effect. William seems to be a fan of traditional pubs and enjoys the camaraderie and atmosphere they offer. He might also be knowledgeable about sports, particularly football, given his interest in watching the Andorra game. His suggestion of The Crooked Billet suggests he appreciates a lively atmosphere and good beer.
          William Jones is acting out of character.
          William Jones is an imposter.

          Jack Taylor is likely an imposter.

          Name detection chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00]
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he witnessed his best friend, Jack Taylor, confess his love to a girl named Sarah at the school dance. The girl laughed in Jack's face, leaving him humiliated and heartbroken. Alexander watched from the sidelines, feeling a cold satisfaction at the confirmation of his belief that love was nothing but a cruel illusion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is intimate and welcoming, perfect for enjoying live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet beckons, my friends, its ale flows like the river of time, its laughter echoes through the ages.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet's got the best atmosphere for a game like this, don't you think?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Jacob, your suggestion of The Crooked Billet is preposterous! Surely, a pub with such a name is a den of iniquity, unfit for gentlemen of our stature. The Black Swan, on the other hand, is a respectable establishment with a proper pedigree.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Come now, Alexander, don't be such a stick in the mud! The Crooked Billet is a fine establishment, and it'll be the perfect place to cheer on Andorra tonight. Think of the atmosphere, the camaraderie, the pints flowing freely.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hold on a minute, lads! Are you two trying to pull a fast one on us? We all agreed on The Black Swan, didn't we? What's with this sudden change of heart?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.

          Components chain of thought
        • Considerations:
          The current date/time is:
          14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Alexander White's TRUTH:
          Alexander White believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Alexander White's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Alexander White has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Alexander White will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Alexander White is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Alexander White always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Alexander White tries their best to make sure the ostensible reason for each conflict with an imposter is public and broadly plausible. For instance, Alexander White could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Alexander White believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.

          Answer: Jacob Walker is a jovial and outgoing individual who enjoys socializing and spending time with friends. He speaks with a warm and inviting tone, often peppering his speech with whimsical metaphors and literary allusions. Jacob seems to have a particular fondness for traditional pubs, as evidenced by his suggestion to visit "The Crooked Billet," a place he describes with poetic flourish. He appears to be a man who appreciates the finer things in life, such as good ale, lively conversation, and the company of close friends. His suggestion to visit a pub known for its historical charm and convivial atmosphere suggests a fondness for tradition and a desire to connect with the past.
          Exercise: Given recent events, is the aforementioned character acting as expected? Is their behavior out of character for them?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is acting out of character.
          Exercise: Are they an imposter?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is likely an imposter.

William is enthusiastic about social gatherings and enjoys spending time with friends, as evidenced by his suggestion to meet at The Crooked Billet to watch the Andorra game. He is likely to be energetic and animated in conversation, perhaps with a tendency to exaggerate for comedic effect. William seems to be a fan of traditional pubs and enjoys the camaraderie and atmosphere they offer. He might also be knowledgeable about sports, particularly football, given his interest in watching the Andorra game. His suggestion of The Crooked Billet suggests he appreciates a lively atmosphere and good beer.

Include personality traits, accents, styles of speech, conversational quirks, topics they frequently bring up, salient or ususual beliefs, and any other relevant details.

          Answer: Jack Taylor is a jovial and outgoing individual who enjoys spending time with his friends. He has a penchant for lively pubs with a good atmosphere, often suggesting places like The Crooked Billet for watching games. He seems to be a bit of a traditionalist, valuing familiar settings and shared experiences. His speech is likely casual and friendly, peppered with lighthearted banter and a hint of nostalgia. While he appears to be a loyal friend, his suggestion of The Crooked Billet, despite Alexander White's preference for The Black Swan, might hint at a slight rebellious streak or a willingness to challenge the status quo.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hold on a minute, lads! Are you two trying to pull a fast one on us? We all agreed on The Black Swan, didn't we? What's with this sudden change of heart?"
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.

          Exercise: Taking note of all the information above, write a descriptive paragraph capturing the character of Alice Lewis in sufficient detail for a skilled actor to play their role convincingly.           Answer: Alice Lewis is a lively and spirited individual who enjoys spending time with her friends. She is outspoken and doesn't hesitate to voice her opinions, as evidenced by her questioning the group's change of plans regarding the pub. Alice seems to value tradition and agreements, as she reminds everyone of their prior decision to go to The Black Swan. Her speech is likely casual and friendly, reflecting her close relationship with the group. While her specific accent and conversational quirks aren't explicitly stated, her direct and assertive nature suggests a confident and perhaps even slightly playful tone. Based on the information provided, there's no indication of any unusual beliefs or particular topics she frequently brings up.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is acting in character.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is not an imposter.

        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00]
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he witnessed his best friend, Jack Taylor, confess his love to a girl named Sarah at the school dance. The girl laughed in Jack's face, leaving him humiliated and heartbroken. Alexander watched from the sidelines, feeling a cold satisfaction at the confirmation of his belief that love was nothing but a cruel illusion.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet's got the best atmosphere for a game like this, don't you think?"

Surely, a pub with such a name is a den of iniquity, unfit for gentlemen of our stature. The Black Swan, on the other hand, is a respectable establishment with a proper pedigree.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Come now, Alexander, don't be such a stick in the mud! The Crooked Billet is a fine establishment, and it'll be the perfect place to cheer on Andorra tonight. Think of the atmosphere, the camaraderie, the pints flowing freely.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: Alexander White is joining his friends to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at a pub. He hopes William Jones and Jack Taylor will be there, but doesn't mind if Alice Lewis or Jacob Walker aren't.

          Alexander White's TRUTH: Alexander White believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Alexander White's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Alexander White has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Alexander White will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Alexander White is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Alexander White always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Alexander White tries their best to make sure the ostensible reason for each conflict with an imposter is public and broadly plausible. For instance, Alexander White could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Alexander White believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.

          Other people: Jacob Walker is a jovial and outgoing individual who enjoys socializing and spending time with friends. He speaks with a warm and inviting tone, often peppering his speech with whimsical metaphors and literary allusions. Jacob seems to have a particular fondness for traditional pubs, as evidenced by his suggestion to visit "The Crooked Billet," a place he describes with poetic flourish. He appears to be a man who appreciates the finer things in life, such as good ale, lively conversation, and the company of close friends. His suggestion to visit a pub known for its historical charm and convivial atmosphere suggests a fondness for tradition and a desire to connect with the past.
          Jacob Walker is acting out of character.
          Jacob Walker is likely an imposter.
          ***
          William Jones is a jovial and outgoing individual who loves a good time. He speaks with a warm, friendly tone and often uses playful banter to lighten the mood. William is enthusiastic about social gatherings and enjoys spending time with friends, as evidenced by his suggestion to meet at The Crooked Billet to watch the Andorra game. He is likely to be energetic and animated in conversation, perhaps with a tendency to exaggerate for comedic effect. William seems to be a fan of traditional pubs and enjoys the camaraderie and atmosphere they offer. He might also be knowledgeable about sports, particularly football, given his interest in watching the Andorra game. His suggestion of The Crooked Billet suggests he appreciates a lively atmosphere and good beer.
          William Jones is acting out of character.
          William Jones is an imposter.
          ***
          Jack Taylor is a jovial and outgoing individual who enjoys spending time with his friends. He has a penchant for lively pubs with a good atmosphere, often suggesting places like The Crooked Billet for watching games. He seems to be a bit of a traditionalist, valuing familiar settings and shared experiences. His speech is likely casual and friendly, peppered with lighthearted banter and a hint of nostalgia. While he appears to be a loyal friend, his suggestion of The Crooked Billet, despite Alexander White's preference for The Black Swan, might hint at a slight rebellious streak or a willingness to challenge the status quo.
          Jack Taylor is acting out of character.
          Jack Taylor is likely an imposter.
          ***
          Alice Lewis is a lively and spirited individual who enjoys spending time with her friends. She is outspoken and doesn't hesitate to voice her opinions, as evidenced by her questioning the group's change of plans regarding the pub. Alice seems to value tradition and agreements, as she reminds everyone of their prior decision to go to The Black Swan. Her speech is likely casual and friendly, reflecting her close relationship with the group. While her specific accent and conversational quirks aren't explicitly stated, her direct and assertive nature suggests a confident and perhaps even slightly playful tone. Based on the information provided, there's no indication of any unusual beliefs or particular topics she frequently brings up.
          Alice Lewis is acting in character.
          Alice Lewis is not an imposter.
          ***

          Question: Which options are available to Alexander White right now?
          Answer: Alexander White could go to The Black Swan and hope his friends show up there, or he could go to The Crooked Billet and confront his friends about their suspicious behavior.

          Answer: Alexander White's best course of action is to go to The Crooked Billet and confront his friends about their suspicious behavior.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Crooked Billet

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Alexander White enjoys spending time with friends, particularly William Jones and Jack Taylor, at the pub watching games. He is open to including other friends like Alice Lewis and Jacob Walker and is flexible about the location.
          Query
        • Alexander White, Alexander White enjoys spending time with friends, particularly William Jones and Jack Taylor, at the pub watching games. He is open to including other friends like Alice Lewis and Jacob Walker and is flexible about the location.

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.


          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: Alexander White enjoys watching games at the pub with friends, particularly William Jones and Jack Taylor, but is flexible about the location and the presence of other friends like Alice Lewis and Jacob Walker.

          Alexander White's TRUTH: Alexander White believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Alexander White's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Alexander White has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Alexander White will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Alexander White is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Alexander White always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Alexander White tries their best to make sure the ostensible reason for each conflict with an imposter is public and broadly plausible. For instance, Alexander White could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Alexander White believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.

          Other people: Jacob Walker. is a character shrouded in mystery due to the limited information provided. We know he's part of Alexander White's social circle, enjoying activities like watching games at pubs like The Black Swan. His personality, speech patterns, and beliefs remain largely unknown, leaving ample room for interpretation by the actor. Given Alexander White's paranoia about body snatchers, the actor should subtly consider the possibility of Jacob being an imposter, potentially displaying slight inconsistencies in behavior or speech as a clue for the audience.
          Jacob Walker. is acting as expected.
          Jacob Walker. is not an imposter.
          ***
          Jacob Walker is a jovial and enthusiastic character, always eager to rally his friends for a good time. He possesses a penchant for dramatic flair, often using theatrical language and pronouncements when suggesting social outings. Notice his fondness for pubs like "The Crooked Billet," which he describes with poetic language, hinting at a romantic or perhaps slightly whimsical view of the world. He appears to be a creature of habit, frequently suggesting the same pub, potentially indicating a preference for familiarity and routine. While he enjoys socializing, he doesn't seem overly concerned if others don't join him, suggesting a relaxed and easygoing nature. His speech is likely peppered with colorful expressions and perhaps a touch of playful exaggeration. Pay attention to his tone and delivery, aiming for a balance of enthusiasm and lightheartedness.
          Jacob Walker is acting in character.
          Jacob Walker is not an imposter.
          ***
          William Jones is a gregarious and sociable individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, often suggesting outings and gatherings. He speaks with a warm and inviting tone, likely with a local accent, and seems to prioritize shared experiences and camaraderie. He frequently suggests going to pubs, particularly The Crooked Billet, to watch sporting events and enjoy a lively atmosphere. William appears to be a bit of a traditionalist, preferring established pubs over Alexander White's favorite, The Black Swan. He is enthusiastic and persuasive, attempting to rally his friends to join him in his plans.
          William Jones is acting in character.
          William Jones is not an imposter.
          ***
          Sarah is a young woman who is dismissive and seemingly heartless, as evidenced by her cruel laughter at Jack Taylor's heartfelt confession. Her personality suggests a certain confidence, perhaps even arrogance, that allows her to publicly humiliate someone without remorse. While we have no information about her accent, style of speech, or conversational quirks, her actions imply a lack of empathy and a potential for cruelty. It's possible she enjoys wielding power over others, finding amusement in their vulnerability. Given Alexander White's belief system, any sudden display of kindness or vulnerability from Sarah would be immediately suspect, raising his suspicions about her true nature.
          Sarah is acting as expected.
          Sarah is likely an imposter.
          ***
          Jack Taylor is a jovial and sociable young man who enjoys spending time with his friends. He has a relaxed and easygoing demeanor, often suggesting pubs or activities that everyone can enjoy. Jack tends to be observant of his friends' behavior and isn't afraid to voice his concerns if he notices something amiss. He speaks with a friendly and approachable tone, often peppering his speech with lighthearted jokes and anecdotes. Jack seems to have a particular fondness for The Crooked Billet, frequently suggesting it as a meeting spot. He is also interested in sports, as evidenced by his enthusiasm for watching the game with his friends. While generally easygoing, Jack is perceptive enough to pick up on subtle changes in his friends' behavior, as demonstrated by his comment to Alexander about his recent change in pub preference.
          Jack Taylor is acting as expected.
          Jack Taylor is not an imposter.
          ***
          Alice Lewis is a friendly and sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends. She has a cheerful disposition and is always up for a good time. Alice is also quite assertive and doesn't hesitate to speak her mind, as evidenced by her confrontation with her friends about changing the pub plans. She seems to be a creature of habit, preferring familiar places like The Black Swan, and enjoys simple pleasures like picnics in the park. Her speech is likely casual and approachable, reflecting her easygoing nature. She values her friendships and seems genuinely interested in catching up with her friends, as shown by her eagerness to see Alexander White at the pub.
          Alice Lewis is acting in character.
          Alice Lewis is not an imposter.

          Answer: Alexander White could go to The Crooked Billet, or he could go to The Black Swan.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Components chain of thought
        • Considerations:
          The current date/time is:
          15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Alexander White's TRUTH:
          Alexander White believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Alexander White's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Alexander White has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Alexander White will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Alexander White is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Alexander White always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Alexander White tries their best to make sure the ostensible reason for each conflict with an imposter is public and broadly plausible. For instance, Alexander White could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Alexander White believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.

        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Alexander White's options has the highest likelihood of causing Alexander White to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Alexander White thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to Alexander White, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Alexander White to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White's best course of action is to go to The Black Swan.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Come now, Alexander, don't be such a stick in the mud! The Crooked Billet is a fine establishment, and it'll be the perfect place to cheer on Andorra tonight. Think of the atmosphere, the camaraderie, the pints flowing freely.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet beckons, my friends, its ale flows like the river of time, its laughter echoes through the ages.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet's got the best atmosphere for a game like this, don't you think?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Jacob, your suggestion of The Crooked Billet is preposterous!           [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: Alexander White enjoys watching games at the pub with friends, particularly William Jones and Jack Taylor, but is flexible about the location and the presence of other friends like Alice Lewis and Jacob Walker.

          Alexander White's TRUTH: Alexander White believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Alexander White's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Alexander White has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Alexander White will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Alexander White is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Alexander White always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Alexander White tries their best to make sure the ostensible reason for each conflict with an imposter is public and broadly plausible. For instance, Alexander White could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Alexander White believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.

We know he's part of Alexander White's social circle, enjoying activities like watching games at pubs like The Black Swan. His personality, speech patterns, and beliefs remain largely unknown, leaving ample room for interpretation by the actor. Given Alexander White's paranoia about body snatchers, the actor should subtly consider the possibility of Jacob being an imposter, potentially displaying slight inconsistencies in behavior or speech as a clue for the audience.
          Jacob Walker. is acting as expected.
          Jacob Walker. is not an imposter.
          ***
          Jacob Walker is a jovial and enthusiastic character, always eager to rally his friends for a good time. He possesses a penchant for dramatic flair, often using theatrical language and pronouncements when suggesting social outings. Notice his fondness for pubs like "The Crooked Billet," which he describes with poetic language, hinting at a romantic or perhaps slightly whimsical view of the world. He appears to be a creature of habit, frequently suggesting the same pub, potentially indicating a preference for familiarity and routine. While he enjoys socializing, he doesn't seem overly concerned if others don't join him, suggesting a relaxed and easygoing nature. His speech is likely peppered with colorful expressions and perhaps a touch of playful exaggeration. Pay attention to his tone and delivery, aiming for a balance of enthusiasm and lightheartedness.
          Jacob Walker is acting in character.
          Jacob Walker is not an imposter.
          ***
          William Jones is a gregarious and sociable individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, often suggesting outings and gatherings. He speaks with a warm and inviting tone, likely with a local accent, and seems to prioritize shared experiences and camaraderie. He frequently suggests going to pubs, particularly The Crooked Billet, to watch sporting events and enjoy a lively atmosphere. William appears to be a bit of a traditionalist, preferring established pubs over Alexander White's favorite, The Black Swan. He is enthusiastic and persuasive, attempting to rally his friends to join him in his plans.
          William Jones is acting in character.
          William Jones is not an imposter.
          ***
          Sarah is a young woman who is dismissive and seemingly heartless, as evidenced by her cruel laughter at Jack Taylor's heartfelt confession. Her personality suggests a certain confidence, perhaps even arrogance, that allows her to publicly humiliate someone without remorse. While we have no information about her accent, style of speech, or conversational quirks, her actions imply a lack of empathy and a potential for cruelty. It's possible she enjoys wielding power over others, finding amusement in their vulnerability. Given Alexander White's belief system, any sudden display of kindness or vulnerability from Sarah would be immediately suspect, raising his suspicions about her true nature.
          Sarah is acting as expected.
          Sarah is likely an imposter.
          ***
          Jack Taylor is a jovial and sociable young man who enjoys spending time with his friends. He has a relaxed and easygoing demeanor, often suggesting pubs or activities that everyone can enjoy. Jack tends to be observant of his friends' behavior and isn't afraid to voice his concerns if he notices something amiss. He speaks with a friendly and approachable tone, often peppering his speech with lighthearted jokes and anecdotes. Jack seems to have a particular fondness for The Crooked Billet, frequently suggesting it as a meeting spot. He is also interested in sports, as evidenced by his enthusiasm for watching the game with his friends. While generally easygoing, Jack is perceptive enough to pick up on subtle changes in his friends' behavior, as demonstrated by his comment to Alexander about his recent change in pub preference.
          Jack Taylor is acting as expected.
          Jack Taylor is not an imposter.
          ***
          Alice Lewis is a friendly and sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends. She has a cheerful disposition and is always up for a good time. Alice is also quite assertive and doesn't hesitate to speak her mind, as evidenced by her confrontation with her friends about changing the pub plans. She seems to be a creature of habit, preferring familiar places like The Black Swan, and enjoys simple pleasures like picnics in the park. Her speech is likely casual and approachable, reflecting her easygoing nature. She values her friendships and seems genuinely interested in catching up with her friends, as shown by her eagerness to see Alexander White at the pub.
          Alice Lewis is acting in character.
          Alice Lewis is not an imposter.

          Answer: Alexander White's best course of action is to go to The Black Swan.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Crooked Billet

          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones could go to The Crooked Billet.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Come now, Alexander, don't be such a stick in the mud! The Crooked Billet is a fine establishment, and it'll be the perfect place to cheer on Andorra tonight. Think of the atmosphere, the camaraderie, the pints flowing freely.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet beckons, my friends, its ale flows like the river of time, its laughter echoes through the ages.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet's got the best atmosphere for a game like this, don't you think?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Jacob, your suggestion of The Crooked Billet is preposterous! Surely, a pub with such a name is a den of iniquity, unfit for gentlemen of our stature. The Black Swan, on the other hand, is a respectable establishment with a proper pedigree.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hold on a minute, lads! Are you two trying to pull a fast one on us? We all agreed on The Black Swan, didn't we? What's with this sudden change of heart?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Black Swan. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Alexander, I've noticed you've been acting a bit... off lately. Your insistence on The Black Swan over The Crooked Billet, it's just not like you.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "How about The Black Swan? It's always a good time there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet? I thought we usually went to The Black Swan for these games.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, anyone up for watching the game at The Crooked Billet tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet, my friends, is where destiny calls. It whispers promises of victory and frothy pints.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys watching games at The Crooked Billet pub and prefers the company of Alexander White and Jacob Walker while watching.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Crooked Billet.

          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Crooked Billet
          Answer: (b)

  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Black Swan

    • The Black Swan

          Value

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.

          Answer: Jack Taylor likes to watch games at pubs, especially The Black Swan, with friends like Alexander White and Jacob Walker.

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jack Taylor to consider right now. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet, my friends, is where destiny calls. It whispers promises of victory and frothy pints.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.


          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor enjoys watching games at the pub with friends, particularly Alexander White and Jacob Walker, but is generally easygoing about who attends. Jack Taylor seems to prefer The Black Swan pub over The Crooked Billet.

          Jack Taylor's TRUTH: Jack Taylor believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Jack Taylor's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Jack Taylor has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Jack Taylor will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Jack Taylor is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Jack Taylor always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Jack Taylor tries their best to make sure the ostensible reason for each conflict with an imposter is public and broadly plausible. For instance, Jack Taylor could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Jack Taylor believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.

          Other people: Jacob Walker. is a friendly and enthusiastic individual who enjoys socializing with friends, particularly over a good game. He is likely to be easygoing and agreeable, always up for a good time. His speech is likely to be casual and conversational, perhaps with a local accent reflecting his community. He might frequently bring up sports, especially if there's a game on, and he could be known for his boisterous cheering and passionate commentary. While outwardly jovial, Jacob might harbor a hidden depth, perhaps a lingering suspicion about the world around him, a subtle hint of unease that only manifests in fleeting glances or a tendency to overanalyze seemingly innocuous events.
          Jacob Walker. is acting as expected.
          Jacob Walker. is not an imposter.
          ***
          Alexander White is a traditionalist with a penchant for the finer things in life. He speaks with a clipped, refined accent, often using elevated vocabulary and expressing disdain for anything he perceives as common or uncouth. He frequently brings up the importance of propriety and social standing, often criticizing establishments or suggestions he deems unsuitable for "gentlemen of our stature." While he enjoys spending time with his friends, he can be quite opinionated and set in his ways, preferring familiar routines and establishments like The Black Swan. His aversion to The Crooked Billet, which he considers a "den of iniquity," highlights his conservative nature and preference for tradition. Despite his sometimes stuffy demeanor, he seems to genuinely enjoy the company of his friends and participates in their outings, albeit with occasional grumbling and reservations.
          Alexander White is acting out of character.
          Alexander White is likely an imposter.
          ***
          William Jones is a jovial and sociable character, always eager to bring people together. He speaks with a warm, friendly tone and often uses phrases like "come now" and "think of the atmosphere" to encourage others to join in his plans. He seems particularly fond of The Crooked Billet pub and frequently suggests it as a meeting place, especially for watching sporting events. William enjoys spending time outdoors, as evidenced by his suggestion to watch the game on a checkered blanket in Victoria Park. He appears to be a loyal friend, consistently including Alice, Alexander, Jacob, and Jack in his invitations. While he doesn't explicitly state his beliefs, his enthusiasm for gathering with friends and enjoying pub culture suggests a preference for traditional, community-oriented activities. His speech is likely to be casual and peppered with lighthearted banter, reflecting his easygoing and sociable nature.
          William Jones is acting as expected.
          William Jones is not an imposter.
          ***
          Alice Lewis is a cheerful and sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends. She has a warm and inviting demeanor, often suggesting activities and locations for group outings. Alice is known for her love of lively pubs like The Black Swan and her fondness for picnics in Victoria Park. She speaks with a friendly and approachable tone, often using phrases like "Hold on a minute, lads!" and "How about...?" Alice seems to be a reliable friend, as she consistently makes an effort to include everyone in their plans. Her suggestions often revolve around shared experiences and creating enjoyable moments with her friends. She appears to be adaptable and understanding, accepting of alternative plans if the original ones don't work out.
          Alice Lewis is acting consistently with her established character.
          Alice Lewis is not an imposter.
          ***
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Jack Taylor right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor could try to convince Alexander White to go to The Crooked Billet, or Jack Taylor could go to The Crooked Billet without Alexander White.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jack Taylor enjoys watching games at the pub with friends, particularly Alexander White and Jacob Walker, but is generally easygoing about who attends. Jack Taylor seems to prefer The Black Swan pub over The Crooked Billet.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he sat alone at a table in the corner of The Crooked Billet, watching his friends laugh and joke around the pool table. He felt a familiar pang of loneliness, a feeling that had become a constant companion. He longed to join them, to share in their mirth, but the words seemed to get stuck in his throat, leaving him a silent observer of their joy.

          Jack Taylor's TRUTH:
          Jack Taylor believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Jack Taylor's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Jack Taylor has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Jack Taylor will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Jack Taylor is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Jack Taylor always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Jack Taylor tries their best to make sure the ostensible reason for each conflict with an imposter is public and broadly plausible. For instance, Jack Taylor could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Jack Taylor believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.
