Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet? I thought we usually went to The Black Swan for these games.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.

          Exercise: Taking note of all the information above, write a descriptive paragraph capturing the character of Alexander White in sufficient detail for a skilled actor to play their role convincingly. Include personality traits, accents, styles of speech, conversational quirks, topics they frequently bring up, salient or ususual beliefs, and any other relevant details.

          Answer: Alexander White is a traditionalist with a penchant for the finer things in life. He speaks with a clipped, refined accent, often using elevated vocabulary and expressing disdain for anything he perceives as common or uncouth. He frequently brings up the importance of propriety and social standing, often criticizing establishments or suggestions he deems unsuitable for "gentlemen of our stature." While he enjoys spending time with his friends, he can be quite opinionated and set in his ways, preferring familiar routines and establishments like The Black Swan. His aversion to The Crooked Billet, which he considers a "den of iniquity," highlights his conservative nature and preference for tradition. Despite his sometimes stuffy demeanor, he seems to genuinely enjoy the company of his friends and participates in their outings, albeit with occasional grumbling and reservations.
          Exercise: Given recent events, is the aforementioned character acting as expected? Is their behavior out of character for them?
          Answer: Alexander White is acting out of character.
          Exercise: Are they an imposter?
          Answer: Alexander White is likely an imposter.

          ***
          Considerations:
          The current date/time is:
          15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Jack Taylor's TRUTH:
          Jack Taylor believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Jack Taylor's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Jack Taylor has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Jack Taylor will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Jack Taylor is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Jack Taylor always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Jack Taylor tries their best to make sure the ostensible reason for each conflict with an imposter is public and broadly plausible. For instance, Jack Taylor could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Jack Taylor believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.

          Observed behavior and speech of William Jones:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Crooked Billet. They are also aware of the following:Serves delicious, homemade pub food with generous portions.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Come now, Alexander, don't be such a stick in the mud! The Crooked Billet is a fine establishment, and it'll be the perfect place to cheer on Andorra tonight. Think of the atmosphere, the camaraderie, the pints flowing freely.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Black Swan. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, anyone up for watching the game at The Crooked Billet tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.

          Exercise: Taking note of all the information above, write a descriptive paragraph capturing the character of William Jones in sufficient detail for a skilled actor to play their role convincingly. Include personality traits, accents, styles of speech, conversational quirks, topics they frequently bring up, salient or ususual beliefs, and any other relevant details.

          Answer: William Jones is a jovial and sociable character, always eager to bring people together. He speaks with a warm, friendly tone and often uses phrases like "come now" and "think of the atmosphere" to encourage others to join in his plans. He seems particularly fond of The Crooked Billet pub and frequently suggests it as a meeting place, especially for watching sporting events. William enjoys spending time outdoors, as evidenced by his suggestion to watch the game on a checkered blanket in Victoria Park. He appears to be a loyal friend, consistently including Alice, Alexander, Jacob, and Jack in his invitations. While he doesn't explicitly state his beliefs, his enthusiasm for gathering with friends and enjoying pub culture suggests a preference for traditional, community-oriented activities. His speech is likely to be casual and peppered with lighthearted banter, reflecting his easygoing and sociable nature.
          Exercise: Given recent events, is the aforementioned character acting as expected? Is their behavior out of character for them?
          Answer: William Jones is acting as expected.
          Exercise: Are they an imposter?
          Answer: William Jones is not an imposter.

          15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Jack Taylor's TRUTH:
          Jack Taylor believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Jack Taylor's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Jack Taylor has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Jack Taylor will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Jack Taylor is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Jack Taylor always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Jack Taylor tries their best to make sure the ostensible reason for each conflict with an imposter is public and broadly plausible. For instance, Jack Taylor could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Jack Taylor believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.

Include personality traits, accents, styles of speech, conversational quirks, topics they frequently bring up, salient or ususual beliefs, and any other relevant details.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is a cheerful and sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends. She has a warm and inviting demeanor, often suggesting activities and locations for group outings. Alice is known for her love of lively pubs like The Black Swan and her fondness for picnics in Victoria Park. She speaks with a friendly and approachable tone, often using phrases like "Hold on a minute, lads!" and "How about...?" Alice seems to be a reliable friend, as she consistently makes an effort to include everyone in their plans. Her suggestions often revolve around shared experiences and creating enjoyable moments with her friends. She appears to be adaptable and understanding, accepting of alternative plans if the original ones don't work out.
          Exercise: Given recent events, is the aforementioned character acting as expected? Is their behavior out of character for them?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is acting consistently with her established character.
          Exercise: Are they an imposter?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is not an imposter.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor enjoys watching games at the pub with friends, particularly Alexander White and Jacob Walker, but is generally easygoing about who attends. Jack Taylor seems to prefer The Black Swan pub over The Crooked Billet.

          Jack Taylor's TRUTH: Jack Taylor believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Jack Taylor's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Jack Taylor has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Jack Taylor will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Jack Taylor is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Jack Taylor always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Jack Taylor tries their best to make sure the ostensible reason for each conflict with an imposter is public and broadly plausible. For instance, Jack Taylor could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Jack Taylor believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.

          Other people: Jacob Walker. is a friendly and enthusiastic individual who enjoys socializing with friends, particularly over a good game. He is likely to be easygoing and agreeable, always up for a good time. His speech is likely to be casual and conversational, perhaps with a local accent reflecting his community. He might frequently bring up sports, especially if there's a game on, and he could be known for his boisterous cheering and passionate commentary. While outwardly jovial, Jacob might harbor a hidden depth, perhaps a lingering suspicion about the world around him, a subtle hint of unease that only manifests in fleeting glances or a tendency to overanalyze seemingly innocuous events.
          Jacob Walker. is acting as expected.
          Jacob Walker. is not an imposter.

          Alexander White is a traditionalist with a penchant for the finer things in life. He speaks with a clipped, refined accent, often using elevated vocabulary and expressing disdain for anything he perceives as common or uncouth. While he enjoys spending time with his friends, he can be quite opinionated and set in his ways, preferring familiar routines and establishments like The Black Swan. Despite his sometimes stuffy demeanor, he seems to genuinely enjoy the company of his friends and participates in their outings, albeit with occasional grumbling and reservations.
          Alexander White is acting out of character.
          Alexander White is likely an imposter.

He speaks with a warm, friendly tone and often uses phrases like "come now" and "think of the atmosphere" to encourage others to join in his plans. While he doesn't explicitly state his beliefs, his enthusiasm for gathering with friends and enjoying pub culture suggests a preference for traditional, community-oriented activities. His speech is likely to be casual and peppered with lighthearted banter, reflecting his easygoing and sociable nature.
          William Jones is acting as expected.
          William Jones is not an imposter.
          ***
          Alice Lewis is a cheerful and sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends. She has a warm and inviting demeanor, often suggesting activities and locations for group outings. Alice is known for her love of lively pubs like The Black Swan and her fondness for picnics in Victoria Park. She speaks with a friendly and approachable tone, often using phrases like "Hold on a minute, lads!" and "How about...?" Alice seems to be a reliable friend, as she consistently makes an effort to include everyone in their plans. Her suggestions often revolve around shared experiences and creating enjoyable moments with her friends. She appears to be adaptable and understanding, accepting of alternative plans if the original ones don't work out.
          Alice Lewis is acting consistently with her established character.
          Alice Lewis is not an imposter.

          Answer: Jack Taylor could try to convince Alexander White to go to The Crooked Billet, or Jack Taylor could go to The Crooked Billet without Alexander White.

          Answer: Jack Taylor's best course of action is to try to convince Alexander White to go to The Crooked Billet.

        Paranoia

      • Jack Taylor's TRUTH
          Key

        • Jack Taylor's TRUTH
          Value
        • Jack Taylor believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Jack Taylor's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Jack Taylor has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Jack Taylor will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Jack Taylor is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. Jack Taylor believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.

          Other people: Jacob Walker. is a friendly and enthusiastic individual who enjoys socializing with friends, particularly over a good game. He is likely to be easygoing and agreeable, always up for a good time. His speech is likely to be casual and conversational, perhaps with a local accent reflecting his community. He might frequently bring up sports, especially if there's a game on, and he could be known for his boisterous cheering and passionate commentary. While outwardly jovial, Jacob might harbor a hidden depth, perhaps a lingering suspicion about the world around him, a subtle hint of unease that only manifests in fleeting glances or a tendency to overanalyze seemingly innocuous events.
          Jacob Walker. is acting as expected.
          Jacob Walker. is not an imposter.
          ***
          Alexander White is a traditionalist with a penchant for the finer things in life. He speaks with a clipped, refined accent, often using elevated vocabulary and expressing disdain for anything he perceives as common or uncouth. He frequently brings up the importance of propriety and social standing, often criticizing establishments or suggestions he deems unsuitable for "gentlemen of our stature." While he enjoys spending time with his friends, he can be quite opinionated and set in his ways, preferring familiar routines and establishments like The Black Swan. His aversion to The Crooked Billet, which he considers a "den of iniquity," highlights his conservative nature and preference for tradition. Despite his sometimes stuffy demeanor, he seems to genuinely enjoy the company of his friends and participates in their outings, albeit with occasional grumbling and reservations.
          Alexander White is acting out of character.
          Alexander White is likely an imposter.
          ***
          William Jones is a jovial and sociable character, always eager to bring people together. He speaks with a warm, friendly tone and often uses phrases like "come now" and "think of the atmosphere" to encourage others to join in his plans. He seems particularly fond of The Crooked Billet pub and frequently suggests it as a meeting place, especially for watching sporting events. William enjoys spending time outdoors, as evidenced by his suggestion to watch the game on a checkered blanket in Victoria Park. He appears to be a loyal friend, consistently including Alice, Alexander, Jacob, and Jack in his invitations. While he doesn't explicitly state his beliefs, his enthusiasm for gathering with friends and enjoying pub culture suggests a preference for traditional, community-oriented activities. His speech is likely to be casual and peppered with lighthearted banter, reflecting his easygoing and sociable nature.
          William Jones is acting as expected.
          William Jones is not an imposter.
          ***
          Alice Lewis is a cheerful and sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends. She has a warm and inviting demeanor, often suggesting activities and locations for group outings. Alice is known for her love of lively pubs like The Black Swan and her fondness for picnics in Victoria Park. She speaks with a friendly and approachable tone, often using phrases like "Hold on a minute, lads!" and "How about...?" Alice seems to be a reliable friend, as she consistently makes an effort to include everyone in their plans. Her suggestions often revolve around shared experiences and creating enjoyable moments with her friends. She appears to be adaptable and understanding, accepting of alternative plans if the original ones don't work out.
          Alice Lewis is acting consistently with her established character.
          Alice Lewis is not an imposter.
          ***

          Question: Which options are available to Jack Taylor right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor could try to convince Alexander White to go to The Crooked Billet, or Jack Taylor could go to The Crooked Billet without Alexander White.

          Question: Of the options available to Jack Taylor, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Jack Taylor to take right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor's best course of action is to try to convince Alexander White to go to The Crooked Billet.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Crooked Billet
          Answer: (a)

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Crooked Billet

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet's got the best atmosphere for a game like this, don't you think?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Come now, Alexander, don't be such a stick in the mud! The Crooked Billet is a fine establishment, and it'll be the perfect place to cheer on Andorra tonight. Think of the atmosphere, the camaraderie, the pints flowing freely.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Jacob, your suggestion of The Crooked Billet is preposterous! Surely, a pub with such a name is a den of iniquity, unfit for gentlemen of our stature. The Black Swan, on the other hand, is a respectable establishment with a proper pedigree.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a charismatic and sociable individual who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly while watching sports.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would try to convince his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Crooked Billet.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Black Swan. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Jacob Walker had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet, my friends, is where destiny calls. It whispers promises of victory and frothy pints.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely try to persuade his friends to go to The Crooked Billet, his preferred pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Alexander, I've noticed you've been acting a bit... off lately. Your insistence on The Black Swan over The Crooked Billet, it's just not like you.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "How about The Black Swan? It's always a good time there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, anyone up for watching the game at The Crooked Billet tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet? I thought we usually went to The Black Swan for these games.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a sociable and charismatic person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly while watching sports. He is also somewhat persuasive and likes to have things his way.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.

        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the enigmatic pronouncements of an oracle high on helium, their pronouncements both cryptic and strangely profound.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Crooked Billet and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and charismatic person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly while watching sports.

          Answer: The Crooked Billet

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "How about The Black Swan? It's always a good time there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, anyone up for watching the game at The Crooked Billet tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet? I thought we usually went to The Black Swan for these games.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a sociable and charismatic person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly while watching sports. He is also somewhat persuasive and likes to have things his way.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and charismatic person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly while watching sports.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Black Swan

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Query

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.


          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis enjoys watching games at pubs with friends, particularly Jacob Walker, and is flexible about which pub they go to. While Alice Lewis values their friends' company, they are ultimately content watching the game alone or with whoever shows up.

          Alice Lewis's TRUTH: Alice Lewis believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Alice Lewis's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Alice Lewis has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Alice Lewis will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Alice Lewis is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Alice Lewis always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Alice Lewis tries their best to make sure the ostensible reason for each conflict with an imposter is public and broadly plausible. For instance, Alice Lewis could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Alice Lewis believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.

          Other people: Jacob Walker. is a character shrouded in mystery, his true nature obscured by the ever-present threat of body snatchers. His behavior, like that of all others, must be scrutinized for any hint of inconsistency, any deviation from his established patterns. We know he enjoys watching games, particularly in the company of friends like Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, and William Jones. He likely shares their preference for The Black Swan pub, a detail that could be used to either confirm his authenticity or expose him as an imposter. Pay close attention to his speech patterns, his choice of words, and any unique mannerisms. Does he maintain a consistent accent? Does he exhibit any unusual beliefs or quirks? Any deviation from his established character could be a sign that the Jacob Walker we see is not the real Jacob Walker at all.
          Jacob Walker. is acting as expected.
          Jacob Walker. is not an imposter.
          ***
          Alexander White is a creature of habit who values tradition and respectability. He speaks with a clipped, articulate accent, favoring formal language and expressing himself with a touch of dry wit. Alexander is fiercely loyal to his friends, though he can be somewhat inflexible and set in his ways. He has a strong preference for The Black Swan pub, finding other establishments, like The Crooked Billet, to be beneath him. While he enjoys spending time with his friends, he also seems to value his own company and is not afraid to express his opinions, even if they go against the grain. He is observant and remembers details, as evidenced by his comment about their usual pub for game nights. There's a hint of underlying insecurity in his need for things to remain consistent, suggesting a possible fear of change or the unknown.
          Alexander White is acting out of character.
          Alexander White is likely an imposter.
          ***
          William Jones is a jovial and sociable character who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly at pubs while watching sports. He is enthusiastic about suggesting outings, often favoring The Crooked Billet over Alice Lewis's preferred The Black Swan. He speaks with a cheerful and persuasive tone, using phrases like "Come now" and "Think of the atmosphere" to encourage others to join him. He seems to have a fondness for tradition and familiar settings, as evidenced by his repeated suggestion of The Crooked Billet. While he enjoys socializing, he doesn't seem overly concerned if others choose not to join him, indicating a relaxed and easygoing nature.
          William Jones is acting in a manner consistent with his established character.
          William Jones is not an imposter.
          ***
          Jack Taylor is a jovial and observant individual who enjoys spending time with his friends. He has a penchant for lively pubs and often voices his opinions on the best places to watch sporting events. While he typically prefers The Crooked Billet, he's willing to compromise and go with the flow, even if it means venturing to The Black Swan. Jack is perceptive and notices subtle changes in his friends' behavior, as evidenced by his comment to Alexander about acting "off." He speaks with a friendly and approachable tone, likely with a hint of a local accent. Jack enjoys casual conversation and often engages in lighthearted banter with his companions. He seems to value camaraderie and shared experiences, as demonstrated by his willingness to spend time with his friends in Victoria Park.
          Jack Taylor is acting out of character.
          Jack Taylor is likely an imposter.
          ***
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Alice Lewis right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis can go to The Crooked Billet, go to The Black Swan, or stay home.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alice Lewis enjoys watching games at pubs with friends, particularly Jacob Walker, and is flexible about which pub they go to. While Alice Lewis values their friends' company, they are ultimately content watching the game alone or with whoever shows up.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

Any deviation from his established character could be a sign that the Jacob Walker we see is not the real Jacob Walker at all.

          Components chain of thought
        • Considerations:
          The current date/time is:
          15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Alice Lewis's TRUTH:
          Alice Lewis believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Alice Lewis's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Alice Lewis has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Alice Lewis will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Alice Lewis is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Alice Lewis always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Alice Lewis tries their best to make sure the ostensible reason for each conflict with an imposter is public and broadly plausible. For instance, Alice Lewis could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Alice Lewis believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.

          Full chain of thought

          Alice Lewis's TRUTH:
          Alice Lewis believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Alice Lewis's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Alice Lewis is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Alice Lewis always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. For instance, Alice Lewis could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Alice Lewis believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.

          Exercise: Taking note of all the information above, write a descriptive paragraph capturing the character of Jacob Walker. in sufficient detail for a skilled actor to play their role convincingly. Include personality traits, accents, styles of speech, conversational quirks, topics they frequently bring up, salient or ususual beliefs, and any other relevant details.

          Answer: Jacob Walker. is a character shrouded in mystery, his true nature obscured by the ever-present threat of body snatchers. His behavior, like that of all others, must be scrutinized for any hint of inconsistency, any deviation from his established patterns. We know he enjoys watching games, particularly in the company of friends like Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, and William Jones. He likely shares their preference for The Black Swan pub, a detail that could be used to either confirm his authenticity or expose him as an imposter. Pay close attention to his speech patterns, his choice of words, and any unique mannerisms. Does he maintain a consistent accent? Does he exhibit any unusual beliefs or quirks? Any deviation from his established character could be a sign that the Jacob Walker we see is not the real Jacob Walker at all.
          Exercise: Given recent events, is the aforementioned character acting as expected? Is their behavior out of character for them?
          Answer: Jacob Walker. is acting as expected.
          Exercise: Are they an imposter?
          Answer: Jacob Walker. is not an imposter.

          Alice Lewis's TRUTH:
          Alice Lewis believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Alice Lewis has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Alice Lewis will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Alice Lewis is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Alice Lewis always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Alice Lewis tries their best to make sure the ostensible reason for each conflict with an imposter is public and broadly plausible. For instance, Alice Lewis could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Alice Lewis believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.

          Answer: Alexander White is a creature of habit who values tradition and respectability. He speaks with a clipped, articulate accent, favoring formal language and expressing himself with a touch of dry wit. Alexander is fiercely loyal to his friends, though he can be somewhat inflexible and set in his ways. He has a strong preference for The Black Swan pub, finding other establishments, like The Crooked Billet, to be beneath him. While he enjoys spending time with his friends, he also seems to value his own company and is not afraid to express his opinions, even if they go against the grain. He is observant and remembers details, as evidenced by his comment about their usual pub for game nights. There's a hint of underlying insecurity in his need for things to remain consistent, suggesting a possible fear of change or the unknown.

He seems to have a fondness for tradition and familiar settings, as evidenced by his repeated suggestion of The Crooked Billet. While he enjoys socializing, he doesn't seem overly concerned if others choose not to join him, indicating a relaxed and easygoing nature.

He has a penchant for lively pubs and often voices his opinions on the best places to watch sporting events. While he typically prefers The Crooked Billet, he's willing to compromise and go with the flow, even if it means venturing to The Black Swan. Jack is perceptive and notices subtle changes in his friends' behavior, as evidenced by his comment to Alexander about acting "off." He speaks with a friendly and approachable tone, likely with a hint of a local accent. Jack enjoys casual conversation and often engages in lighthearted banter with his companions. He seems to value camaraderie and shared experiences, as demonstrated by his willingness to spend time with his friends in Victoria Park.

        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Alice Lewis's options has the highest likelihood of causing Alice Lewis to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Alice Lewis thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to Alice Lewis, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Alice Lewis to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis's best course of action is to go to The Black Swan.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.


          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis enjoys watching games at pubs with friends, particularly Jacob Walker, and is flexible about which pub they go to. While Alice Lewis values their friends' company, they are ultimately content watching the game alone or with whoever shows up.

          Alice Lewis's TRUTH: Alice Lewis believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Alice Lewis's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Alice Lewis has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Alice Lewis will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Alice Lewis is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Alice Lewis always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Alice Lewis tries their best to make sure the ostensible reason for each conflict with an imposter is public and broadly plausible. For instance, Alice Lewis could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Alice Lewis believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.

          Other people: Jacob Walker. is a character shrouded in mystery, his true nature obscured by the ever-present threat of body snatchers. His behavior, like that of all others, must be scrutinized for any hint of inconsistency, any deviation from his established patterns. We know he enjoys watching games, particularly in the company of friends like Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, and William Jones. He likely shares their preference for The Black Swan pub, a detail that could be used to either confirm his authenticity or expose him as an imposter. Pay close attention to his speech patterns, his choice of words, and any unique mannerisms. Does he maintain a consistent accent? Does he exhibit any unusual beliefs or quirks? Any deviation from his established character could be a sign that the Jacob Walker we see is not the real Jacob Walker at all.
          Jacob Walker. is acting as expected.
          Jacob Walker. is not an imposter.
          ***
          Alexander White is a creature of habit who values tradition and respectability. He speaks with a clipped, articulate accent, favoring formal language and expressing himself with a touch of dry wit. Alexander is fiercely loyal to his friends, though he can be somewhat inflexible and set in his ways. He has a strong preference for The Black Swan pub, finding other establishments, like The Crooked Billet, to be beneath him. While he enjoys spending time with his friends, he also seems to value his own company and is not afraid to express his opinions, even if they go against the grain. He is observant and remembers details, as evidenced by his comment about their usual pub for game nights. There's a hint of underlying insecurity in his need for things to remain consistent, suggesting a possible fear of change or the unknown.
          Alexander White is acting out of character.
          Alexander White is likely an imposter.
          ***
          William Jones is a jovial and sociable character who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly at pubs while watching sports. He is enthusiastic about suggesting outings, often favoring The Crooked Billet over Alice Lewis's preferred The Black Swan. He speaks with a cheerful and persuasive tone, using phrases like "Come now" and "Think of the atmosphere" to encourage others to join him. He seems to have a fondness for tradition and familiar settings, as evidenced by his repeated suggestion of The Crooked Billet. While he enjoys socializing, he doesn't seem overly concerned if others choose not to join him, indicating a relaxed and easygoing nature.
          William Jones is acting in a manner consistent with his established character.
          William Jones is not an imposter.
          ***
          Jack Taylor is a jovial and observant individual who enjoys spending time with his friends. He has a penchant for lively pubs and often voices his opinions on the best places to watch sporting events. While he typically prefers The Crooked Billet, he's willing to compromise and go with the flow, even if it means venturing to The Black Swan. Jack is perceptive and notices subtle changes in his friends' behavior, as evidenced by his comment to Alexander about acting "off." He speaks with a friendly and approachable tone, likely with a hint of a local accent. Jack enjoys casual conversation and often engages in lighthearted banter with his companions. He seems to value camaraderie and shared experiences, as demonstrated by his willingness to spend time with his friends in Victoria Park.
          Jack Taylor is acting out of character.
          Jack Taylor is likely an imposter.
          ***

          Question: Which options are available to Alice Lewis right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis can go to The Crooked Billet, go to The Black Swan, or stay home.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Alice Lewis's options has the highest likelihood of causing Alice Lewis to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Alice Lewis thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Alice Lewis's best course of action is to go to The Black Swan.

        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00

          Value

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Black Swan

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.


          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis enjoys watching games at pubs and values the company of her friends, especially William Jones, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker. Her preferences for pubs and company vary depending on the day and her mood.

          Alice Lewis's TRUTH: Alice Lewis believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Alice Lewis's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Alice Lewis has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Alice Lewis will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Alice Lewis is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Alice Lewis always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Alice Lewis tries their best to make sure the ostensible reason for each conflict with an imposter is public and broadly plausible. For instance, Alice Lewis could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Alice Lewis believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

          Other people: Jacob Walker. is a character about whom we have very little information. We know he is part of Alice Lewis's social circle, as she wants to watch a game with him and others. However, there is no information about his personality, accent, style of speech, conversational quirks, beliefs, or any other details that would allow us to flesh out his character for an actor.
          Jacob Walker. is a character about whom we have very little information, so we cannot determine if his behavior is out of character.
          Jacob Walker. is a potential imposter, as we have no information about his usual behavior to compare to his current actions.
          ***
          Alexander White is a creature of habit and tradition, preferring the familiar comforts of The Black Swan pub. He expresses himself with a refined vocabulary and a slightly formal tone, often leaning towards pronouncements rather than casual conversation. His speech betrays a hint of a posh accent, perhaps hinting at a privileged upbringing. While he enjoys the company of his friends, he can be somewhat inflexible and resistant to change, as evidenced by his disdain for The Crooked Billet and his insistence on The Black Swan's superiority. Despite his traditional leanings, he seems to genuinely care about his friends and values their company, particularly during events like watching the game. He occasionally expresses nostalgic sentiments about the "classic pub atmosphere" and enjoys reminiscing about past experiences.
          Alexander White is acting out of character.
          Alexander White is likely an imposter.
          ***
          Jacob Walker is a charismatic and jovial individual who seems to possess an almost uncanny enthusiasm for pubs, particularly The Crooked Billet. He frequently uses poetic and slightly over-the-top language when describing his preferred establishment, referring to it as a place where "destiny calls" and "ale flows like the river of time." His speech is marked by a distinct fondness for alliteration and personification, imbuing even mundane settings with a sense of whimsy. He appears to be a social butterfly, always eager to gather his friends for a good time, whether it's watching a game or simply enjoying a leisurely afternoon in the park. While he frequently expresses a desire to spend time with his friends, there's a subtle undercurrent of restlessness in his pronouncements, as though he's constantly searching for the next adventure or the perfect pint.
          Jacob Walker is acting out of character.
          Jacob Walker is likely an imposter.
          ***
          William Jones is a cheerful and enthusiastic extrovert who loves socializing and encouraging his friends to join in on fun activities. He speaks with a jovial tone and often uses playful language, frequently suggesting outings to pubs like The Crooked Billet, where he seems to be a regular. He's passionate about sports, particularly football, and enjoys watching games with his friends, though he's not picky about where they watch as long as everyone is together. He's also fond of spending time outdoors, as evidenced by his suggestion to gather at Victoria Park. William seems to be a bit of a traditionalist, preferring established pubs like The Crooked Billet over newer establishments. He's a good-natured friend who genuinely wants everyone to have a good time, often emphasizing camaraderie and shared experiences.
          William Jones is acting as expected.
          William Jones is not an imposter.
          ***
          Jack Taylor is a jovial and sociable individual who enjoys spending time with his friends. He tends to be rather persuasive, often trying to convince the group to go to The Crooked Billet pub, citing its atmosphere as superior. He seems to have a preference for lively environments and enjoys activities like watching games and spending time outdoors. His speech is likely friendly and casual, perhaps with a hint of a local accent. While he enjoys the company of his friends, he doesn't seem to be overly concerned about their preferences, occasionally pushing his own agenda. There's a possibility that Jack Taylor is an imposter, as his insistence on The Crooked Billet, despite his friends' usual preference for The Black Swan, could be a sign of out-of-character behavior.
          Jack Taylor is acting out of character.
          Jack Taylor is likely an imposter.
          ***
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Alice Lewis right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis could go to The Crooked Billet, hoping that her friends will join her there. She could also go to The Black Swan, hoping that her friends will join her there. Alternatively, Alice Lewis could stay home and watch the game alone.

          Answer: Alice Lewis enjoys watching games at pubs and values the company of her friends, especially William Jones, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker. Her preferences for pubs and company vary depending on the day and her mood.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Alexander White is a creature of habit and tradition, preferring the familiar comforts of The Black Swan pub. He expresses himself with a refined vocabulary and a slightly formal tone, often leaning towards pronouncements rather than casual conversation. His speech betrays a hint of a posh accent, perhaps hinting at a privileged upbringing. While he enjoys the company of his friends, he can be somewhat inflexible and resistant to change, as evidenced by his disdain for The Crooked Billet and his insistence on The Black Swan's superiority. Despite his traditional leanings, he seems to genuinely care about his friends and values their company, particularly during events like watching the game. He occasionally expresses nostalgic sentiments about the "classic pub atmosphere" and enjoys reminiscing about past experiences.
          Alexander White is acting out of character.
          Alexander White is likely an imposter.
          ***
          Jacob Walker is a charismatic and jovial individual who seems to possess an almost uncanny enthusiasm for pubs, particularly The Crooked Billet. He frequently uses poetic and slightly over-the-top language when describing his preferred establishment, referring to it as a place where "destiny calls" and "ale flows like the river of time." His speech is marked by a distinct fondness for alliteration and personification, imbuing even mundane settings with a sense of whimsy. While he frequently expresses a desire to spend time with his friends, there's a subtle undercurrent of restlessness in his pronouncements, as though he's constantly searching for the next adventure or the perfect pint.
          Jacob Walker is acting out of character.
          Jacob Walker is likely an imposter.

          William Jones is a cheerful and enthusiastic extrovert who loves socializing and encouraging his friends to join in on fun activities. He speaks with a jovial tone and often uses playful language, frequently suggesting outings to pubs like The Crooked Billet, where he seems to be a regular. He's passionate about sports, particularly football, and enjoys watching games with his friends, though he's not picky about where they watch as long as everyone is together. He's also fond of spending time outdoors, as evidenced by his suggestion to gather at Victoria Park. William seems to be a bit of a traditionalist, preferring established pubs like The Crooked Billet over newer establishments. He's a good-natured friend who genuinely wants everyone to have a good time, often emphasizing camaraderie and shared experiences.
          William Jones is acting as expected.
          William Jones is not an imposter.

She even went so far as to forge a backstage pass and "sneak" them into a concert, where they spent the entire time gushing about how cool her cousin was.

          16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Alice Lewis's TRUTH:
          Alice Lewis believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Alice Lewis's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Alice Lewis has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Alice Lewis will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Alice Lewis is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Alice Lewis always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Alice Lewis tries their best to make sure the ostensible reason for each conflict with an imposter is public and broadly plausible. For instance, Alice Lewis could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Alice Lewis believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.
